* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `add-component-via-interceptor` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `auth-method`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `auth-method` attribute value.
* `auth-method` attribute description: the authentication method. valid values are 'none' and '`username_password`'.

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `authentication-context` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=caller-propagation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `client-requires`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `client-requires` attribute value.
* `client-requires` attribute description: value that indicates the client `ssl` required parameters (none, `serverauth`, `clientauth`, `mutualauth`).
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=client-requires)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `client-requires-ssl`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `client-requires-ssl` attribute value.
* `client-requires-ssl` attribute description: indicates whether `iiop` connections from the server require `ssl`.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=client-requires-ssl)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `client-ssl-context`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `client-ssl-context` attribute value.
* `client-ssl-context` attribute description: the name of the `ssl` context used to create client side `ssl` sockets.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=client-ssl-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `client-supports`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `client-supports` attribute value.
* `client-supports` attribute description: value that indicates the client `ssl` supported parameters (none, `serverauth`, `clientauth`, `mutualauth`).
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=client-supports)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `confidentiality`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `confidentiality` attribute value.
* `confidentiality` attribute description: indicates whether the transport must require confidentiality protection or not. valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=confidentiality)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `detect-misordering`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `detect-misordering` attribute value.
* `detect-misordering` attribute description: indicates whether the transport must require `misordering` detection or not. valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=detect-misordering)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `detect-replay`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `detect-replay` attribute value.
* `detect-replay` attribute description: indicates whether the transport must require replay detection or not. valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=detect-replay)`

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `export-corbaloc` attribute value.
* `export-corbaloc` attribute description: indicates whether the root context should be exported as `corbaloc::address:port/nameservice` (on) or not (off).
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=export-corbaloc)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `giop-version`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `giop-version` attribute value.
* `giop-version` attribute description: the `giop` version to be used.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=giop-version)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `high-water-mark`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `high-water-mark` attribute value.
* `high-water-mark` attribute description: `tcp` connection cache parameter. each time the number of connections exceeds this value orb tries to reclaim connections. number of reclaimed connections is specified by `tcp-number-to-reclaim` property. if this property is not set then it is configured as `openjdk` orb default.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=high-water-mark)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `integrity`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `integrity` attribute value.
* `integrity` attribute description: indicates whether the transport must require integrity protection or not. valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=integrity)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `iona`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `iona` attribute value.
* `iona` attribute description: indicates whether `interoperability` with `iona's` asp is enabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=iona)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `number-to-reclaim`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `number-to-reclaim` attribute value.
* `number-to-reclaim` attribute description: `tcp` connection cache parameter. each time number of connections exceeds `tcp-high-water-mark` property then orb tries to reclaim connections. number of reclaimed connections is specified by this property. if it is not set then it is configured as `openjdk` orb default.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=number-to-reclaim)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `persistent-server-id`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `persistent-server-id` attribute value.
* `persistent-server-id` attribute description: persistent id of the server. persistent object references are valid across many `activactions` of the server and they identify it using this property. as a result of that: many activations of the same server should have this property set to the same value, different server instances running on the same host should have different server ids.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=persistent-server-id)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `properties`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `properties` attribute value.
* `properties` attribute description: a list of generic `key/value` properties.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `realm`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `realm` attribute value.
* `realm` attribute description: the authentication service (as) realm name.

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `required`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `required` attribute value.
* `required` attribute description: indicates if authentication is required (true) or not (false).

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `root-context` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `security` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: the name of the security domain that holds the key and trust stores that will be used to establish `ssl` connections.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `server-requires`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `server-requires` attribute value.
* `server-requires` attribute description: value that indicates the server `ssl` required parameters (none, `serverauth`, `clientauth`, `mutualauth`).
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=server-requires)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `server-requires-ssl`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `server-requires-ssl` attribute value.
* `server-requires-ssl` attribute description: indicates whether `iiop` connections to the server require `ssl`.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=server-requires-ssl)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `server-ssl-context`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `server-ssl-context` attribute value.
* `server-ssl-context` attribute description: the name of the `ssl` context used to create server side `ssl` sockets.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=server-ssl-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `server-supports`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `server-supports` attribute value.
* `server-supports` attribute description: value that indicates the server `ssl` supported parameters (none, `serverauth`, `clientauth`, `mutualauth`).
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=server-supports)`

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `socket-binding` attribute value.
* `socket-binding` attribute description: the name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the orb port. at least one of `socket-binding`, `ssl-socket-binding` parameters have to be configured.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `ssl-socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `ssl-socket-binding` attribute value.
* `ssl-socket-binding` attribute description: the name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the orb `ssl` port. at least one of `socket-binding`, `ssl-socket-binding` parameters have to be configured.
* operation: `/subsystem=iiop-openjdk:read-attribute(name=ssl-socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `iiop-openjdk` `support-ssl`
* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `support-ssl` attribute value.
* `support-ssl` attribute description: indicates whether `ssl` is to be supported (on) or not (off).

* Retrieve the `iiop-openjdk` `transactions` attribute value.

'deep' shares the extended persistence context at top bean level.  'shallow' the extended `persistece` context is only shared with the parent bean (never with sibling beans).

* Retrieve the `messaging-activemq` `global-client-thread-pool-current-thread-count` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `messaging-activemq` `global-client-thread-pool-largest-thread-count` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get a `messaging-activemq` `discovery-group`
* operation: `/subsystem=messaging-activemq/discovery-group=<discovery-group name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `messaging-activemq` `discovery-group` use '*' for `<discovery-group name>`.

* Retrieve the `messaging-activemq` `discovery-group` `initial-wait-timeout` attribute value.
* `initial-wait-timeout` attribute description: period, in ms, to wait for an initial broadcast to give us at least one node in the cluster.
* operation: `/subsystem=messaging-activemq/discovery-group=<discovery-group name>:read-attribute(name=initial-wait-timeout)`

* Retrieve the `messaging-activemq` `jgroups-discovery-group` `initial-wait-timeout` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=messaging-activemq/jms-bridge=<jms-bridge name>:read-attribute(name=failure-retry-interval)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `hornetq-store-enable-async-io`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `hornetq-store-enable-async-io` attribute value.
* `hornetq-store-enable-async-io` attribute description: whether `asyncio` should be enabled for the journal store.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=hornetq-store-enable-async-io)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-action-store-drop-table`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-action-store-drop-table` attribute value.
* `jdbc-action-store-drop-table` attribute description: if set to true then the `jdbc-action-store` table will be dropped during application server startup.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-action-store-drop-table)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-action-store-table-prefix`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-action-store-table-prefix` attribute value.
* `jdbc-action-store-table-prefix` attribute description: optional prefix for the name of the database table used for writing transaction log records of the action store type.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-action-store-table-prefix)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-communication-store-drop-table`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-communication-store-drop-table` attribute value.
* `jdbc-communication-store-drop-table` attribute description: if set to true then the `jdbc-communication-store` table will be dropped during application server startup.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-communication-store-drop-table)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-communication-store-table-prefix`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-communication-store-table-prefix` attribute value.
* `jdbc-communication-store-table-prefix` attribute description: optional prefix for the name of the database table used for writing transaction log records of the communication store type.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-communication-store-table-prefix)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-state-store-drop-table`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-state-store-drop-table` attribute value.
* `jdbc-state-store-drop-table` attribute description: if set to true then the `jdbc-state-store` table will be dropped during application server startup.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-state-store-drop-table)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-state-store-table-prefix`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-state-store-table-prefix` attribute value.
* `jdbc-state-store-table-prefix` attribute description: optional prefix for the name of the database table used for writing transaction log records of the state store type.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-state-store-table-prefix)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jdbc-store-datasource`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jdbc-store-datasource` attribute value.
* `jdbc-store-datasource` attribute description: the `jndi` name of a `non-xa` `datasource` (`i.e`. one whose '`jta`' attribute is set to false) to be used for the `jdbc` store. the `datasource` must be defined in the `datasources` subsystem.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jdbc-store-datasource)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `journal-store-enable-async-io`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `journal-store-enable-async-io` attribute value.
* `journal-store-enable-async-io` attribute description: whether `asyncio` should be enabled for the journal store. when true, the transaction manager will use the native `aio` (`posix` asynchronous `i/o`) libraries provided by the platform, if available. applicable only when `use-journal-store` is set true.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=journal-store-enable-async-io)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `jts`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `jts` attribute value.
* `jts` attribute description: if true, this enables the java transaction service (`jts`). if `jts` is enabled then the transactions attribute of the '`iiop-openjdk`' subsystem must be set to 'full'. this setting changes the internal mechanisms used in the transaction manager. it has no impact on the user working with `jta` `api`.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=jts)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `maximum-timeout`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `maximum-timeout` attribute value.
* `maximum-timeout` attribute description: if the '`default-timeout`' attribute is zero then this value is used for setting the maximum timeout value (in seconds) for newly started transactions.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=maximum-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `node-identifier`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `node-identifier` attribute value.
* `node-identifier` attribute description: used to set the node identifier. each `xid` that the transaction manager creates will have this identifier encoded within it and ensures the transaction manager will only recover branches which match the specified identifier. it is imperative that this identifier is unique between application server instances which share either an object store or access common resource managers.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=node-identifier)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-aborted-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-aborted-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-aborted-transactions` attribute description: the number of aborted (`i.e`. `rolled-back`) transactions.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-aborted-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-application-rollbacks`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-application-rollbacks` attribute value.
* `number-of-application-rollbacks` attribute description: the number of transactions that have been rolled back by application request. this includes those that timeout, since the timeout behavior is considered an attribute of the application configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-application-rollbacks)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-committed-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-committed-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-committed-transactions` attribute description: the number of committed transactions.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-committed-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-heuristics`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-heuristics` attribute value.
* `number-of-heuristics` attribute description: the number of transactions which have terminated with heuristic outcomes.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-heuristics)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-inflight-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-inflight-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-inflight-transactions` attribute description: the number of transactions that have begun but not yet terminated.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-inflight-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-nested-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-nested-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-nested-transactions` attribute description: the total number of nested (sub) transactions created.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-nested-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-resource-rollbacks`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-resource-rollbacks` attribute value.
* `number-of-resource-rollbacks` attribute description: the number of transactions that rolled back due to resource (participant) failure.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-resource-rollbacks)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-system-rollbacks`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-system-rollbacks` attribute value.
* `number-of-system-rollbacks` attribute description: the number of transactions that have been rolled back due to internal system errors.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-system-rollbacks)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-timed-out-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-timed-out-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-timed-out-transactions` attribute description: the number of transactions that have rolled back due to timeout.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-timed-out-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `number-of-transactions`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `number-of-transactions` attribute value.
* `number-of-transactions` attribute description: the total number of transactions (`top-level` and nested) created.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=number-of-transactions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `object-store-path`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `object-store-path` attribute value.
* `object-store-path` attribute description: denotes a path where the transaction manager object store should store data. by default the value is treated as relative to the path denoted by the '`relative-to`' attribute. when the '`relative-to`' attribute is undefined the value is considered an absolute path. this setting is valid when default or journal store is used. `it's` not used when the `jdbc` journal store is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=object-store-path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `object-store-relative-to`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `object-store-relative-to` attribute value.
* `object-store-relative-to` attribute description: references a global path configuration in the domain model, defaulting to the application server data directory (`jboss.server.data.dir`). the value of the '`object-store-path`' attribute will be treated as relative to this path. undefine this attribute to disable the default behavior and force the value of the '`object-store-path`' attribute to be treated as an absolute path.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=object-store-relative-to)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `process-id-socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `process-id-socket-binding` attribute value.
* `process-id-socket-binding` attribute description: the name of the socket binding to use if the transaction manager should use a `socket-based` generation of transaction id. will be 'undefined' if '`process-id-uuid`' is 'true'; otherwise must be set.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=process-id-socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `process-id-socket-max-ports`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `process-id-socket-max-ports` attribute value.
* `process-id-socket-max-ports` attribute description: the maximum number of ports to search for an open port if the transaction manager should use a `socket-based` generation of transaction id. if the port specified by the socket binding referenced in '`process-id-socket-binding`' is occupied, the next higher port will be tried until an open port is found or the number of ports specified by this attribute have been tried. will be 'undefined' if '`process-id-uuid`' is 'true'.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=process-id-socket-max-ports)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `process-id-uuid`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `process-id-uuid` attribute value.
* `process-id-uuid` attribute description: indicates a strategy used for obtaining a unique identifier needed for creation of transaction instances. when true then the transaction manager generates the transaction id based on process id (`pid`). when set to false then the transaction manager generates the transaction id based on the referenced socket binding, `i.e`. the attribute '`process-id-socket-binding`' is required.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=process-id-uuid)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `recovery-listener`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `recovery-listener` attribute value.
* `recovery-listener` attribute description: used to specify if the recovery system should listen on a network socket or not. when true the application server binds to a socket at the port defined by the '`socket-binding`' attribute. when the recovery listener is activated the user can remotely control the recovery manager.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=recovery-listener)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `socket-binding` attribute value.
* `socket-binding` attribute description: references an existing socket binding that the transaction manager will listen on for recovery requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `stale-transaction-time`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `stale-transaction-time` attribute value.
* `stale-transaction-time` attribute description: the time for which transaction that contains remote enlistments is held in memory after it is being completed.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=stale-transaction-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: whether transaction statistics should be gathered. the statistics are available by reading subsystem attributes prefixed with 'number-' and within the '`average-commit-time`' attribute.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `status-socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `status-socket-binding` attribute value.
* `status-socket-binding` attribute description: references an existing socket binding that the transaction manager will listen on for transaction status requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=status-socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `use-hornetq-store`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `use-hornetq-store` attribute value.
* `use-hornetq-store` attribute description: use the journal store for writing transaction logs. set to true to enable and to false to use the default log store type. the default log store is normally one file system file per transaction `log.it's` alternative to `jdbc` based store.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=use-hornetq-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `use-jdbc-store`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `use-jdbc-store` attribute value.
* `use-jdbc-store` attribute description: use the `jdbc` store for writing transaction logs. data is saved in the database indicated by the '`jdbc-store-datasource`' attribute. set to true to enable. note that the server will not boot if both '`use-journal-store`' and '`use-jdbc-store`' attributes are set to true. if both are set to false then the default `filesystem` based store will be used.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=use-jdbc-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `use-journal-store`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `use-journal-store` attribute value.
* `use-journal-store` attribute description: use the journal store for writing transaction logs. the journal store consists of one file for all the transactions. set to true to enable. note that the server will not boot if both '`use-journal-store`' and '`use-jdbc-store`' attributes are set to true. if both are set to false then the default `filesystem` based store will be used.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions:read-attribute(name=use-journal-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `expose-all-logs`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `expose-all-logs` attribute value.
* `expose-all-logs` attribute description: configures the behaviour of the probe operation. when true then all transaction log records are exposed. by default only a subset of the transaction log is exposed.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store:read-attribute(name=expose-all-logs)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `type`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: `read-only` attribute that specifies the implementation type of the logging store. the possible values are default, journal and `jdbc`.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions`
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` use '*' for `<transactions name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `age-in-seconds`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `age-in-seconds` attribute value.
* `age-in-seconds` attribute description: the time since this transaction was prepared or when the recovery system last tried to recover it.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>:read-attribute(name=age-in-seconds)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `id`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `id` attribute value.
* `id` attribute description: the id of this transaction.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>:read-attribute(name=id)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `jmx-name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `jmx-name` attribute value.
* `jmx-name` attribute description: the `jmx` name of this transaction.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>:read-attribute(name=jmx-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `type`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: the type name under which this record is stored.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants`
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` use '*' for `<participants name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `eis-product-name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `eis-product-name` attribute value.
* `eis-product-name` attribute description: the jakarta connectors enterprise information `system's` product name.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=eis-product-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `eis-product-version`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `eis-product-version` attribute value.
* `eis-product-version` attribute description: the jakarta connectors enterprise information `system's` product version.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=eis-product-version)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `jmx-name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `jmx-name` attribute value.
* `jmx-name` attribute description: the `jmx` name of this participant.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=jmx-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `jndi-name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `jndi-name` attribute value.
* `jndi-name` attribute description: `jndi` name of this participant.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=jndi-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `status`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `status` attribute value.
* `status` attribute description: reports the commitment status of this participant (can be one of pending, prepared, failed, heuristic or `readonly`).
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=status)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `type`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `log-store` `log-store` `transactions` `participants` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: the type name under which this record is stored.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/log-store=log-store/transactions=<transactions name>/participants=<participants name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `transactions` `commit-markable-resource`
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/commit-markable-resource=<commit-markable-resource name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` use '*' for `<commit-markable-resource name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `batch-size`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `batch-size` attribute value.
* `batch-size` attribute description: configures number of ids placed within 'in' clause of the `sql` query 'delete from ... where `xid` in (...)' when periodic recovery processes the `cmr` database table garbage collection. when some garbage is left in the `cmr` database table after deletion another `sql` delete is run during the next recovery cycle. when '`immediate-cleanup`' is used this configuration has no big impact as the periodic recovery finds each time an empty `cmr` database table.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/commit-markable-resource=<commit-markable-resource name>:read-attribute(name=batch-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `immediate-cleanup`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `immediate-cleanup` attribute value.
* `immediate-cleanup` attribute description: immediate cleanup of ids associated with this `cmr` resource after the end of the transaction. when set to false the garbage collection of the ids is processed by periodic recovery.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/commit-markable-resource=<commit-markable-resource name>:read-attribute(name=immediate-cleanup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `jndi-name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `jndi-name` attribute value.
* `jndi-name` attribute description: a `jndi` name of the `non-xa` `datasource` which is made to be a `cmr` resource for the purpose of transaction manager participant handling. the `datasource` is required to be marked as '`connectable=true`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/commit-markable-resource=<commit-markable-resource name>:read-attribute(name=jndi-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `name`
* Retrieve the `transactions` `commit-markable-resource` `name` attribute value.
* `name` attribute description: defines the database table name used for storing ids associated with this `cmr` resource. the default value for naming the database table is '`xids`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=transactions/commit-markable-resource=<commit-markable-resource name>:read-attribute(name=name)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `modcluster` `proxy`
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `modcluster` `proxy` use '*' for `<proxy name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise` attribute value.
* `advertise` attribute description: whether to enable `multicast-based` advertise mechanism.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=advertise)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise-security-key`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise-security-key` attribute value.
* `advertise-security-key` attribute description: if specified, reverse proxy advertisements checksums will be verified using this value as a salt.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=advertise-security-key)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise-socket`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `advertise-socket` attribute value.
* `advertise-socket` attribute description: name of socket binding to use for the advertise socket.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=advertise-socket)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `auto-enable-contexts`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `auto-enable-contexts` attribute value.
* `auto-enable-contexts` attribute description: if false, the contexts are registered with the reverse proxy as disabled, they need to be enabled manually by '`enable-context`' operation or via `mod_cluster_manager` console (if available).
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=auto-enable-contexts)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `balancer`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `balancer` attribute value.
* `balancer` attribute description: the name of the balancer on the reverse proxy to register with.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=balancer)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `excluded-contexts`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `excluded-contexts` attribute value.
* `excluded-contexts` attribute description: list of contexts to exclude from registration with the reverse proxies.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=excluded-contexts)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `flush-packets`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `flush-packets` attribute value.
* `flush-packets` attribute description: whether to enable packet flushing on the reverse proxy.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=flush-packets)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `flush-wait`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `flush-wait` attribute value.
* `flush-wait` attribute description: time to wait before flushing packets on the reverse proxy.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=flush-wait)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `listener`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `listener` attribute value.
* `listener` attribute description: the name of undertow listener that will be registered with the reverse proxy.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=listener)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-balancing-group`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-balancing-group` attribute value.
* `load-balancing-group` attribute description: name of the load balancing group this node belongs to.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=load-balancing-group)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `max-attempts`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `max-attempts` attribute value.
* `max-attempts` attribute description: maximum number of `failover` attempts by reverse proxy when sending the request to the `backend` server.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=max-attempts)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `node-timeout`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `node-timeout` attribute value.
* `node-timeout` attribute description: timeout (in seconds) for proxy connections to a node. that is the time `mod_cluster` will wait for the `back-end` response before returning an error.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=node-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `ping`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `ping` attribute value.
* `ping` attribute description: number of seconds for which to wait for a pong answer to a ping.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=ping)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `proxies`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `proxies` attribute value.
* `proxies` attribute description: list of reverse proxies for `mod_cluster` to register with defined by '`outbound-socket-binding`' in '`socket-binding-group`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=proxies)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `proxy-url`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `proxy-url` attribute value.
* `proxy-url` attribute description: base `url` for `mcmp` requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `session-draining-strategy`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `session-draining-strategy` attribute value.
* `session-draining-strategy` attribute description: session draining strategy used during `undeployment` of a web application.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=session-draining-strategy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `smax`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `smax` attribute value.
* `smax` attribute description: soft maximum idle connection count for reverse proxy.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=smax)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `socket-timeout`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `socket-timeout` attribute value.
* `socket-timeout` attribute description: timeout to wait for the reverse proxy to answer a `mcmp` message.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=socket-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `ssl-context`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `ssl-context` attribute value.
* `ssl-context` attribute description: reference to the `sslcontext` to be used by `mod_cluster`.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `status-interval`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `status-interval` attribute value.
* `status-interval` attribute description: number of seconds a status message is sent from the application server to the proxy.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=status-interval)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session` attribute value.
* `sticky-session` attribute description: indicates whether subsequent requests for a given session should be routed to the same node, if possible.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=sticky-session)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session-force`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session-force` attribute value.
* `sticky-session-force` attribute description: indicates whether the reverse proxy should run an error in the event that the balancer is unable to route a request to the node to which it is stuck. ignored if sticky sessions are disabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=sticky-session-force)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session-remove`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `sticky-session-remove` attribute value.
* `sticky-session-remove` attribute description: indicates whether the reverse proxy should remove session stickiness in the event that the balancer is unable to route a request to the node to which it is stuck. ignored if sticky sessions are disabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=sticky-session-remove)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `stop-context-timeout`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `stop-context-timeout` attribute value.
* `stop-context-timeout` attribute description: maximum time to wait for context to process pending requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=stop-context-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `ttl`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `ttl` attribute value.
* `ttl` attribute description: time to live (in seconds) for idle connections above `smax`.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=ttl)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `worker-timeout`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `worker-timeout` attribute value.
* `worker-timeout` attribute description: number of seconds to wait for a worker to become available to handle a request.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>:read-attribute(name=worker-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `decay`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `decay` attribute value.
* `decay` attribute description: the factor by which a historic load values should degrade in significance.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic:read-attribute(name=decay)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `history`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `history` attribute value.
* `history` attribute description: the number of historic (previous) load values to consider in the load balance factor computation.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic:read-attribute(name=history)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `initial-load`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `initial-load` attribute value.
* `initial-load` attribute description: initial load within the range [`0..100`] with which to `prepopulate` historical values. used to gradually drive load to the node. value of `0` `prepopulates` with full load and value of -`1` disables this behavior.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic:read-attribute(name=initial-load)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric`
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/load-metric=<load-metric name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` use '*' for `<load-metric name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `capacity`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `capacity` attribute value.
* `capacity` attribute description: maximum capacity of the metric used to normalize the load values from a metric which require explicit capacity.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/load-metric=<load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=capacity)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `property`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `property` attribute value.
* `property` attribute description: properties to apply on a loaded metric instance.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/load-metric=<load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=property)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `type`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: type of a `built-in` load metric from the enumerated values.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/load-metric=<load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `weight`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `load-metric` `weight` attribute value.
* `weight` attribute description: number indicating the significance of a metric with respect to the other metrics. for example, a metric of weight `2` will have twice the impact on the overall load factor than a metric of weight `1`.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/load-metric=<load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=weight)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric`
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` use '*' for `<custom-load-metric name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `capacity`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `capacity` attribute value.
* `capacity` attribute description: maximum capacity of the metric used to normalize the load values from a metric which require explicit capacity.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=capacity)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `class`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `class` attribute value.
* `class` attribute description: class name to use to construct a load metric from.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `module`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `module` attribute value.
* `module` attribute description: module name from which to load the load metric class.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `property`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `property` attribute value.
* `property` attribute description: properties to apply on a loaded metric instance.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=property)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `weight`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `dynamic` `custom-load-metric` `weight` attribute value.
* `weight` attribute description: number indicating the significance of a metric with respect to the other metrics. for example, a metric of weight `2` will have twice the impact on the overall load factor than a metric of weight `1`.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=dynamic/custom-load-metric=<custom-load-metric name>:read-attribute(name=weight)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `simple` `factor`
* Retrieve the `modcluster` `proxy` `load-provider` `simple` `factor` attribute value.
* `factor` attribute description: dynamic load provider computes the load balance factor of a node from a defined set of load metrics.
* operation: `/subsystem=modcluster/proxy=<proxy name>/load-provider=simple:read-attribute(name=factor)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `discovery` `static-provider`
* operation: `/subsystem=discovery/static-provider=<static-provider name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `discovery` `static-provider` use '*' for `<static-provider name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `discovery` `static-provider` `services`
* Retrieve the `discovery` `static-provider` `services` attribute value.
* `services` attribute description: the list of services that are configured with this provider
* operation: `/subsystem=discovery/static-provider=<static-provider name>:read-attribute(name=services)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `discovery` `aggregate-provider`
* operation: `/subsystem=discovery/aggregate-provider=<aggregate-provider name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `discovery` `aggregate-provider` use '*' for `<aggregate-provider name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `discovery` `aggregate-provider` `providers`
* Retrieve the `discovery` `aggregate-provider` `providers` attribute value.
* `providers` attribute description: the list of providers that are aggregated by this provider
* operation: `/subsystem=discovery/aggregate-provider=<aggregate-provider name>:read-attribute(name=providers)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `infinispan` `cache-container`
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `infinispan` `cache-container` use '*' for `<cache-container name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `aliases`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `aliases` attribute value.
* `aliases` attribute description: the list of aliases for this cache container
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=aliases)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `cache-manager-status`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `cache-manager-status` attribute value.
* `cache-manager-status` attribute description: the status of the cache manager component. may return null if the cache manager is not started.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=cache-manager-status)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `cluster-name`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `cluster-name` attribute value.
* `cluster-name` attribute description: the name of the cluster this node belongs to. may return null if the cache manager is not started.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=cluster-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `coordinator-address`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `coordinator-address` attribute value.
* `coordinator-address` attribute description: the logical address of the `cluster's` coordinator. may return null if the cache manager is not started.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=coordinator-address)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `default-cache`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `default-cache` attribute value.
* `default-cache` attribute description: the default `infinispan` cache
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=default-cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `is-coordinator`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `is-coordinator` attribute value.
* `is-coordinator` attribute description: set to true if this node is the `cluster's` coordinator. may return null if the cache manager is not started.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=is-coordinator)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-address`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-address` attribute value.
* `local-address` attribute description: the local address of the node. may return null if the cache manager is not started.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=local-address)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `marshaller`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `marshaller` attribute value.
* `marshaller` attribute description: defines the marshalling implementation used to marshal cache entries.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=marshaller)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `modules`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `modules` attribute value.
* `modules` attribute description: the set of modules associated with this cache `container's` configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=modules)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: if enabled, statistics will be collected for this cache container
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache`
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` use '*' for `<local-cache name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `modules`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `modules` attribute value.
* `modules` attribute description: the set of modules associated with this `cache's` configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>:read-attribute(name=modules)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: if enabled, statistics will be collected for this cache
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `acquire-timeout`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `acquire-timeout` attribute value.
* `acquire-timeout` attribute description: maximum time to attempt a particular lock acquisition.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=locking:read-attribute(name=acquire-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `concurrency-level`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `concurrency-level` attribute value.
* `concurrency-level` attribute description: concurrency level for lock containers. adjust this value according to the number of concurrent threads interacting with `infinispan`.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=locking:read-attribute(name=concurrency-level)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `isolation`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `isolation` attribute value.
* `isolation` attribute description: sets the cache locking isolation level.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=locking:read-attribute(name=isolation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `striping`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `locking` `striping` attribute value.
* `striping` attribute description: if true, a pool of shared locks is maintained for all entries that need to be locked. otherwise, a lock is created per entry in the cache. lock striping helps control memory footprint but may reduce concurrency in the system.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=locking:read-attribute(name=striping)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `interval`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `interval` attribute value.
* `interval` attribute description: interval (in milliseconds) between subsequent runs to purge expired entries from memory and any cache stores. if you wish to disable the periodic eviction process altogether, set `wakeupinterval` to -`1`.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=expiration:read-attribute(name=interval)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `lifespan`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `lifespan` attribute value.
* `lifespan` attribute description: maximum lifespan of a cache entry, after which the entry is expired `cluster-wide`, in milliseconds. -`1` means the entries never expire.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=expiration:read-attribute(name=lifespan)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `max-idle`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `expiration` `max-idle` attribute value.
* `max-idle` attribute description: maximum idle time a cache entry will be maintained in the cache, in milliseconds. if the idle time is exceeded, the entry will be expired `cluster-wide`. -`1` means the entries never expire.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=expiration:read-attribute(name=max-idle)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `complete-timeout`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `complete-timeout` attribute value.
* `complete-timeout` attribute description: the duration (in ms) after which idle transactions are removed.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=transaction:read-attribute(name=complete-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `locking`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `locking` attribute value.
* `locking` attribute description: the locking mode for this cache, one of optimistic or pessimistic.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=transaction:read-attribute(name=locking)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `mode`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `mode` attribute value.
* `mode` attribute description: sets the cache transaction mode to one of none, `non_xa`, `non_durable_xa`, `full_xa`.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=transaction:read-attribute(name=mode)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `stop-timeout`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `component` `transaction` `stop-timeout` attribute value.
* `stop-timeout` attribute description: if there are any ongoing transactions when a cache is stopped, `infinispan` waits for ongoing remote and local transactions to finish. the amount of time to wait for is defined by the cache stop timeout.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/component=transaction:read-attribute(name=stop-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `cache`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `cache` attribute value.
* `cache` attribute description: the name of the remote cache to use for this remote store.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `fetch-state`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `fetch-state` attribute value.
* `fetch-state` attribute description: if true, fetch persistent state when joining a cluster. if multiple cache stores are chained, only one of them can have this property enabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=fetch-state)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `max-batch-size`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `max-batch-size` attribute value.
* `max-batch-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a batch to be `inserted/deleted` from the store. if the value is less than one, then no upper limit is placed on the number of operations in a batch.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=max-batch-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `passivation`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=passivation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `preload`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `preload` attribute value.
* `preload` attribute description: if true, when the cache starts, data stored in the cache store will be `pre-loaded` into memory. this is particularly useful when data in the cache store will be needed immediately after startup and you want to avoid cache operations being delayed as a result of loading this data lazily. can be used to provide a '`warm-cache`' on startup, however there is a performance penalty as startup time is affected by this process.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=preload)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `shared`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `remote` `shared` attribute value.
* `shared` attribute description: this setting should be set to true when multiple cache instances share the same cache store (`e.g`., multiple nodes in a cluster using a `jdbc-based` `cachestore` pointing to the same, shared database.) setting this to true avoids multiple cache instances writing the same modification multiple times. if enabled, only the node where the modification originated will write to the cache store. if disabled, each individual cache reacts to a potential remote update by storing the data to the cache store.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=remote:read-attribute(name=shared)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `custom` `passivation`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `custom` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=custom:read-attribute(name=passivation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `jdbc` `table` `string` `timestamp-column`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `fetch-state`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `fetch-state` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=fetch-state)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `max-batch-size`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `max-batch-size` attribute value.
* `max-batch-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a batch to be `inserted/deleted` from the store. if the value is less than one, then no upper limit is placed on the number of operations in a batch.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=max-batch-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `passivation`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=passivation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `path`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `path` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `preload`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `preload` attribute value.
* `preload` attribute description: if true, when the cache starts, data stored in the cache store will be `pre-loaded` into memory. this is particularly useful when data in the cache store will be needed immediately after startup and you want to avoid cache operations being delayed as a result of loading this data lazily. can be used to provide a '`warm-cache`' on startup, however there is a performance penalty as startup time is affected by this process.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=preload)`

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `segmented` attribute value.
* `segmented` attribute description: indicates whether or not this cache store should be segment aware.

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `shared`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `local-cache` `store` `file` `shared` attribute value.
* `shared` attribute description: this setting should be set to true when multiple cache instances share the same cache store (`e.g`., multiple nodes in a cluster using a `jdbc-based` `cachestore` pointing to the same, shared database.) setting this to true avoids multiple cache instances writing the same modification multiple times. if enabled, only the node where the modification originated will write to the cache store. if disabled, each individual cache reacts to a potential remote update by storing the data to the cache store.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=shared)`

* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/local-cache=<local-cache name>/store=file/write=behind:read-attribute(name=modification-queue-size)`

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `capacity-factor` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `l1-lifespan` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `modules` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `owners` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `component` `expiration` `interval` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `store` `file` `max-batch-size` attribute value.
* `max-batch-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a batch to be `inserted/deleted` from the store. if the value is less than one, then no upper limit is placed on the number of operations in a batch.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `distributed-cache` `store` `file` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/distributed-cache=<distributed-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=passivation)`

* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/distributed-cache=<distributed-cache name>/store=file:read-attribute(name=preload)`

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `replicated-cache` `store` `hotrod` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/replicated-cache=<replicated-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=passivation)`
