* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=cache-configuration)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `fetch-state`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `fetch-state` attribute value.
* `fetch-state` attribute description: if true, fetch persistent state when joining a cluster. if multiple cache stores are chained, only one of them can have this property enabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=fetch-state)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `max-batch-size`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `max-batch-size` attribute value.
* `max-batch-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a batch to be `inserted/deleted` from the store. if the value is less than one, then no upper limit is placed on the number of operations in a batch.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=max-batch-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `passivation`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `passivation` attribute value.
* `passivation` attribute description: if true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. if false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. this essentially gives you a '`write-through`' configuration.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=passivation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `preload`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `preload` attribute value.
* `preload` attribute description: if true, when the cache starts, data stored in the cache store will be `pre-loaded` into memory. this is particularly useful when data in the cache store will be needed immediately after startup and you want to avoid cache operations being delayed as a result of loading this data lazily. can be used to provide a '`warm-cache`' on startup, however there is a performance penalty as startup time is affected by this process.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=preload)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `properties`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `properties` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `remote-cache-container` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `segmented`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `segmented` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `shared`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `cache-container` `scattered-cache` `store` `hotrod` `shared` attribute value.
* `shared` attribute description: this setting should be set to true when multiple cache instances share the same cache store (`e.g`., multiple nodes in a cluster using a `jdbc-based` `cachestore` pointing to the same, shared database.) setting this to true avoids multiple cache instances writing the same modification multiple times. if enabled, only the node where the modification originated will write to the cache store. if disabled, each individual cache reacts to a potential remote update by storing the data to the cache store.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod:read-attribute(name=shared)`

* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/cache-container=<cache-container name>/scattered-cache=<scattered-cache name>/store=hotrod/write=behind:read-attribute(name=modification-queue-size)`

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `remote-cache-container` `component` `connection-pool` `max-active` attribute value.
* `max-active` attribute description: controls the maximum number of connections per server that are allocated (checked out to client threads, or idle in the pool) at one time. when `non-positive`, there is no limit to the number of connections per server. when `maxactive` is reached, the connection pool for that server is said to be exhausted. value -`1` means no limit.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/remote-cache-container=<remote-cache-container name>/component=connection-pool:read-attribute(name=max-active)`

* Retrieve the `infinispan` `remote-cache-container` `component` `connection-pool` `max-wait` attribute value.
* `max-wait` attribute description: the amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to become available when the exhausted action is `exhaustedaction.wait`, after which a `java.util.nosuchelementexception` will be thrown. if a negative value is supplied, the pool will block indefinitely.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/remote-cache-container=<remote-cache-container name>/component=connection-pool:read-attribute(name=max-wait)`

* `min-evictable-idle-time` attribute description: specifies the minimum amount of time that an connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction due to idle time. when `non-positive`, no connection will be dropped from the pool due to idle time alone. this setting has no effect unless `timebetweenevictionrunsmillis` > `0`.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/remote-cache-container=<remote-cache-container name>/component=connection-pool:read-attribute(name=min-evictable-idle-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `infinispan` `remote-cache-container` `component` `connection-pool` `min-idle`
* Retrieve the `infinispan` `remote-cache-container` `component` `connection-pool` `min-idle` attribute value.
* `min-idle` attribute description: sets a target value for the minimum number of idle connections (per server) that should always be available. if this parameter is set to a positive number and `timebetweenevictionrunsmillis` > `0`, each time the idle connection eviction thread runs, it will try to create enough idle instances so that there will be `minidle` idle instances available for each server.
* operation: `/subsystem=infinispan/remote-cache-container=<remote-cache-container name>/component=connection-pool:read-attribute(name=min-idle)`

* Retrieve the `undertow` `byte-buffer-pool` `thread-local-cache-size` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/byte-buffer-pool=<byte-buffer-pool name>:read-attribute(name=thread-local-cache-size)`

* Retrieve the `undertow` `servlet-container` `allow-orphan-session` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/servlet-container=<servlet-container name>:read-attribute(name=disable-caching-for-secured-pages)`

* Retrieve the `undertow` `configuration` `filter` `mod-cluster` `management-access-predicate` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/configuration=filter/mod-cluster=<mod-cluster name>:read-attribute(name=management-socket-binding)`

* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/configuration=filter/mod-cluster=<mod-cluster name>:read-attribute(name=max-ajp-packet-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `scheme`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `scheme` attribute value.
* `scheme` attribute description: the listener scheme, can be `http` or `https`. by default the scheme will be taken from the incoming `ajp` request.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=scheme)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `secure`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `secure` attribute value.
* `secure` attribute description: if this is true then requests that originate from this listener are marked as secure, even if the request is not using `https`.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=secure)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `send-buffer`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `send-buffer` attribute value.
* `send-buffer` attribute description: the send buffer size, in bytes.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=send-buffer)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `socket-binding` attribute value.
* `socket-binding` attribute description: the listener socket binding
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `tcp-backlog`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `tcp-backlog` attribute value.
* `tcp-backlog` attribute description: configure a server with the specified backlog.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=tcp-backlog)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `tcp-keep-alive`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `tcp-keep-alive` attribute value.
* `tcp-keep-alive` attribute description: configure a channel to send `tcp` `keep-alive` messages in an `implementation-dependent` manner.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=tcp-keep-alive)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `url-charset`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `url-charset` attribute value.
* `url-charset` attribute description: `url` `charset`
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=url-charset)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `worker`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `worker` attribute value.
* `worker` attribute description: the listeners `xnio` worker
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=worker)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `write-timeout`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `ajp-listener` `write-timeout` attribute value.
* `write-timeout` attribute description: configure a write timeout for a socket, in milliseconds.  if the given amount of time elapses without a successful write taking place, the `socket's` next write will throw a {@link `writetimeoutexception`}.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/ajp-listener=<ajp-listener name>:read-attribute(name=write-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `undertow` `server` `https-listener`
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` use '*' for `<https-listener name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-encoded-slash`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-encoded-slash` attribute value.
* `allow-encoded-slash` attribute description: if a request comes in with encoded / characters (`i.e`. %`2f`), will these be decoded.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=allow-encoded-slash)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-equals-in-cookie-value`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-equals-in-cookie-value` attribute value.
* `allow-equals-in-cookie-value` attribute description: if this is true then undertow will allow `non-escaped` equals characters in unquoted cookie values. unquoted cookie values may not contain equals characters. if present the value ends before the equals sign. the remainder of the cookie value will be dropped.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=allow-equals-in-cookie-value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-unescaped-characters-in-url`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `allow-unescaped-characters-in-url` attribute value.
* `allow-unescaped-characters-in-url` attribute description: if this is true undertow will accept `non-encoded` characters that are disallowed by the uri specification. this defaults to false, and in general should not be needed as most clients correctly encode characters. note that setting this to true can be considered a security risk, as allowing `non-standard` characters can allow request smuggling attacks in some circumstances.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=allow-unescaped-characters-in-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `always-set-keep-alive`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `always-set-keep-alive` attribute value.
* `always-set-keep-alive` attribute description: if this is true then a connection: `keep-alive` header will be added to responses, even when it is not strictly required by the specification.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=always-set-keep-alive)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `buffer-pipelined-data`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `buffer-pipelined-data` attribute value.
* `buffer-pipelined-data` attribute description: if we should buffer pipelined requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=buffer-pipelined-data)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `buffer-pool`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `buffer-pool` attribute value.
* `buffer-pool` attribute description: the listeners buffer pool
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=buffer-pool)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `bytes-received`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `bytes-received` attribute value.
* `bytes-received` attribute description: the number of bytes that have been received by this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=bytes-received)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `bytes-sent`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `bytes-sent` attribute value.
* `bytes-sent` attribute description: the number of bytes that have been sent out on this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=bytes-sent)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `certificate-forwarding`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `certificate-forwarding` attribute value.
* `certificate-forwarding` attribute description: if certificate forwarding should be enabled. if this is enabled then the listener will take the certificate from the `ssl_client_cert` attribute. this should only be enabled if behind a proxy, and the proxy is configured to always set these headers.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=certificate-forwarding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `decode-url`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `decode-url` attribute value.
* `decode-url` attribute description: if this is true then the parser will decode the `url` and query parameters using the selected character encoding (`utf-8` by default). if this is false they will not be decoded. this will allow a later handler to decode them into whatever `charset` is desired.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=decode-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `disallowed-methods`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `disallowed-methods` attribute value.
* `disallowed-methods` attribute description: a comma separated list of `http` methods that are not allowed
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=disallowed-methods)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enable-http2`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enable-http2` attribute value.
* `enable-http2` attribute description: enables `http2` support for this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=enable-http2)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enable-spdy`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enable-spdy` attribute value.
* `enable-spdy` attribute description: enables `spdy` support for this listener. this has been deprecated and has no effect, `http/2` should be used instead
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=enable-spdy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled` attribute value.
* `enabled` attribute description: if the listener is enabled
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled-cipher-suites`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled-cipher-suites` attribute value.
* `enabled-cipher-suites` attribute description: configures enabled `ssl` ciphers
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=enabled-cipher-suites)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled-protocols`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `enabled-protocols` attribute value.
* `enabled-protocols` attribute description: configures `ssl` protocols
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=enabled-protocols)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `error-count`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `error-count` attribute value.
* `error-count` attribute description: the number of `500` responses that have been sent by this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=error-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-enable-push`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-enable-push` attribute value.
* `http2-enable-push` attribute description: if server push is enabled for this connection
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-enable-push)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-header-table-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-header-table-size` attribute value.
* `http2-header-table-size` attribute description: the size of the header table used for `hpack` compression, in bytes. this amount of memory will be allocated per connection for compression. larger values use more memory but may give better compression.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-header-table-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-initial-window-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-initial-window-size` attribute value.
* `http2-initial-window-size` attribute description: the flow control window size that controls how quickly the client can send data to the server
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-initial-window-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-concurrent-streams`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-concurrent-streams` attribute value.
* `http2-max-concurrent-streams` attribute description: the maximum number of `http/2` streams that can be active at any time on a single connection
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-max-concurrent-streams)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-frame-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-frame-size` attribute value.
* `http2-max-frame-size` attribute description: the max `http/2` frame size
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-max-frame-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-header-list-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `http2-max-header-list-size` attribute value.
* `http2-max-header-list-size` attribute description: the maximum size of request headers the server is prepared to accept
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=http2-max-header-list-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-buffered-request-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-buffered-request-size` attribute value.
* `max-buffered-request-size` attribute description: maximum size of a buffered request, in bytes. requests are not usually buffered, the most common case is when performing `ssl` renegotiation for a post request, and the post data must be fully buffered in order to perform the renegotiation.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-buffered-request-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-connections`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-connections` attribute value.
* `max-connections` attribute description: the maximum number of concurrent connections. only values greater than `0` are allowed. for unlimited connections simply undefine this attribute value.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-connections)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-cookies`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-cookies` attribute value.
* `max-cookies` attribute description: the maximum number of cookies that will be parsed. this is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-cookies)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-header-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-header-size` attribute value.
* `max-header-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a `http` request header, in bytes.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-header-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-headers`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-headers` attribute value.
* `max-headers` attribute description: the maximum number of headers that will be parsed. this is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-parameters`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-parameters` attribute value.
* `max-parameters` attribute description: the maximum number of parameters that will be parsed. this is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities. this applies to both query parameters, and to post data, but is not cumulative (`i.e`. you can potentially have max parameters * `2` total parameters).
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-parameters)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-post-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-post-size` attribute value.
* `max-post-size` attribute description: the maximum size of a post that will be accepted, in bytes.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-post-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-processing-time`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `max-processing-time` attribute value.
* `max-processing-time` attribute description: the maximum processing time taken by a request on this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=max-processing-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `no-request-timeout`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `no-request-timeout` attribute value.
* `no-request-timeout` attribute description: the length of time in milliseconds that the connection can be idle before it is closed by the container.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=no-request-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `processing-time`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `processing-time` attribute value.
* `processing-time` attribute description: the total processing time of all requests handed by this listener
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=processing-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `proxy-address-forwarding`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `proxy-address-forwarding` attribute value.
* `proxy-address-forwarding` attribute description: enables  handling of `x-forwarded-host` header (and other `x-forwarded`-* headers) and use this header information to set the remote address. this should only be used behind a trusted proxy that sets these headers otherwise a remote user can spoof their `ip` address.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-address-forwarding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `proxy-protocol`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `proxy-protocol` attribute value.
* `proxy-protocol` attribute description: if this is true then the listener will use the proxy protocol `v1`, as defined by `https://www.haproxy.org/download/1.8/doc/proxy-protocol.txt`. this option must only be enabled for listeners that are behind a load balancer that supports the same protocol.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-protocol)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `read-timeout`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `read-timeout` attribute value.
* `read-timeout` attribute description: configure a read timeout for a socket, in milliseconds.  if the given amount of time elapses without a successful read taking place, the `socket's` next read will throw a {@link `readtimeoutexception`}.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=read-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `receive-buffer`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `receive-buffer` attribute value.
* `receive-buffer` attribute description: the receive buffer size, in bytes.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=receive-buffer)`

* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `record-request-start-time` attribute value.
* `record-request-start-time` attribute description: if this is true then undertow will record the request start time, to allow for request time to be logged. this has a small but measurable performance impact
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=record-request-start-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `request-count`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `request-count` attribute value.
* `request-count` attribute description: the number of requests this listener has served
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=request-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `request-parse-timeout`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `request-parse-timeout` attribute value.
* `request-parse-timeout` attribute description: the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that can be spent parsing the request
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=request-parse-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `require-host-http11`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `require-host-http11` attribute value.
* `require-host-http11` attribute description: require that all `http/1.1` requests have a 'host' header, as per the `rfc`. if the request does not include this header it will be rejected with a `403`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `resolve-peer-address`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `resolve-peer-address` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=resolve-peer-address)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `rfc6265-cookie-validation`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `rfc6265-cookie-validation` attribute value.
* `rfc6265-cookie-validation` attribute description: if cookies should be validated to ensure they comply with `rfc6265`.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=rfc6265-cookie-validation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `secure`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `secure` attribute value.
* `secure` attribute description: if this is true then requests that originate from this listener are marked as secure, even if the request is not using `https`.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=secure)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `security-realm`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `security-realm` attribute value.
* `security-realm` attribute description: the listeners security realm
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=security-realm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `send-buffer`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `send-buffer` attribute value.
* `send-buffer` attribute description: the send buffer size, in bytes.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=send-buffer)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `socket-binding`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `socket-binding` attribute value.
* `socket-binding` attribute description: the listener socket binding
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=socket-binding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-context`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-context` attribute value.
* `ssl-context` attribute description: reference to the `sslcontext` to be used by this listener.

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-session-cache-size`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-session-cache-size` attribute value.
* `ssl-session-cache-size` attribute description: the maximum number of active `ssl` sessions
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-session-cache-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-session-timeout`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `ssl-session-timeout` attribute value.
* `ssl-session-timeout` attribute description: the timeout for `ssl` sessions, in seconds
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-session-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `tcp-backlog`
* Retrieve the `undertow` `server` `https-listener` `tcp-backlog` attribute value.
* `tcp-backlog` attribute description: configure a server with the specified backlog.
* operation: `/subsystem=undertow/server=<server name>/https-listener=<https-listener name>:read-attribute(name=tcp-backlog)`

* Retrieve the `undertow` `buffer-cache` `buffers-per-region` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `undertow` `buffer-cache` `max-regions` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-datasource-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-datasource-class-name` attribute value.
* `driver-datasource-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the `javax.sql.datasource` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=driver-datasource-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-major-version`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-major-version` attribute value.
* `driver-major-version` attribute description: the `driver's` major version number
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=driver-major-version)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-minor-version`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-minor-version` attribute value.
* `driver-minor-version` attribute description: the `driver's` minor version number
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=driver-minor-version)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-module-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-module-name` attribute value.
* `driver-module-name` attribute description: the name of the module from which the driver was loaded, if it was loaded from the module path

* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-name` attribute value.
* `driver-name` attribute description: defines the `jdbc` driver the `datasource` should use. it is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. in case the driver is deployed as a jar, the name is the name of the deployment unit
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=driver-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-xa-datasource-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `driver-xa-datasource-class-name` attribute value.
* `driver-xa-datasource-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the `javax.sql.xadatasource` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=driver-xa-datasource-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `jdbc-compliant`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `jdbc-compliant` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=jdbc-compliant)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `module-slot`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `module-slot` attribute value.
* `module-slot` attribute description: the slot of the module from which the driver was loaded, if it was loaded from the module path
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=<jdbc-driver name>:read-attribute(name=module-slot)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `profile`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `jdbc-driver` `profile` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get a `datasources` `data-source`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `datasources` `data-source` use '*' for `<data-source name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `allocation-retry`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `allocation-retry` attribute value.
* `allocation-retry` attribute description: the allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allocation-retry)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `allocation-retry-wait-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `allocation-retry-wait-millis` attribute value.
* `allocation-retry-wait-millis` attribute description: the allocation retry wait `millis` element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allocation-retry-wait-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `allow-multiple-users`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `allow-multiple-users` attribute value.
* `allow-multiple-users` attribute description: specifies if multiple users will access the `datasource` through the `getconnection(user`, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allow-multiple-users)`

* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `authentication-context` attribute value.
* `authentication-context` attribute description: the elytron authentication context which defines the `javax.security.auth.subject` that is used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=authentication-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `background-validation`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `background-validation` attribute value.
* `background-validation` attribute description: an element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. changing this value can be done only on disabled `datasource`,  requires a server restart otherwise.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=background-validation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `background-validation-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `background-validation-millis` attribute value.
* `background-validation-millis` attribute description: the `background-validation-millis` element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. changing this value can be done only on disabled `datasource`,  requires a server restart otherwise
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=background-validation-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `blocking-timeout-wait-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute value.
* `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute description: the `blocking-timeout-millis` element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=blocking-timeout-wait-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-decrementer-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-decrementer-class` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-decrementer-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-decrementer-properties` attribute value.
* `capacity-decrementer-properties` attribute description: properties to be injected in class defining the policy for decrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-decrementer-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-incrementer-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-incrementer-class` attribute value.
* `capacity-incrementer-class` attribute description: class defining the policy for incrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-incrementer-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-incrementer-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute value.
* `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute description: properties to be injected in class defining the policy for incrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-incrementer-properties)`

* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `check-valid-connection-sql` attribute value.
* `check-valid-connection-sql` attribute description: specify an `sql` statement to check validity of a pool connection. this may be called when managed connection is obtained from the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=check-valid-connection-sql)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `connectable`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `connectable` attribute value.
* `connectable` attribute description: enable the use of `cmr`. this feature means that a local resource can reliably participate in an `xa` transaction.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connectable)`

* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-listener-class` attribute value.
* `connection-listener-class` attribute description: `speciefies` class name extending `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.spi.listener.connectionlistener` that provides a possible to listen for connection activation and passivation in order to perform actions before the connection is returned to the application or returned to the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connection-listener-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-listener-property`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-listener-property` attribute value.
* `connection-listener-property` attribute description: properties to be injected in class `specidied` in `connection-listener-class`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connection-listener-property)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-url`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-url` attribute value.
* `connection-url` attribute description: the `jdbc` driver connection `url`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connection-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `credential-reference`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `credential-reference` attribute value.
* `credential-reference` attribute description: credential (from credential store) to authenticate on data source
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=credential-reference)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `datasource-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `datasource-class` attribute value.
* `datasource-class` attribute description: the fully qualified name of the `jdbc` `datasource` class
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=datasource-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `driver-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `driver-class` attribute value.
* `driver-class` attribute description: the fully qualified name of the `jdbc` driver class
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=driver-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `driver-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `driver-name` attribute value.
* `driver-name` attribute description: defines the `jdbc` driver the `datasource` should use. it is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. in case the driver is deployed as a jar, the name is the name of the deployment unit
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=driver-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `elytron-enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `elytron-enabled` attribute value.
* `elytron-enabled` attribute description: enables elytron security for handling authentication of connections. the elytron `authentication-context` to be used will be current context if no context is specified (see `authentication-context`).
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=elytron-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `enabled` attribute value.
* `enabled` attribute description: specifies if the `datasource` should be enabled. note this attribute will not be supported runtime in next versions.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `enlistment-trace`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `enlistment-trace` attribute value.
* `enlistment-trace` attribute description: defines if `wildfly/ironjacamar` should record enlistment traces
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=enlistment-trace)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-class-name` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.exceptionsorter` that provides an `isexceptionfatal(sqlexception`) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-module` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.exceptionsorter` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `exception-sorter-properties` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-properties` attribute description: the exception sorter properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `flush-strategy`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `flush-strategy` attribute value.
* `flush-strategy` attribute description: specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=flush-strategy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `initial-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `initial-pool-size` attribute value.
* `initial-pool-size` attribute description: the `initial-pool-size` element indicates the initial number of connections a pool should hold.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=initial-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `jndi-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `jndi-name` attribute value.
* `jndi-name` attribute description: specifies the `jndi` name for the `datasource`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=jndi-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `jta`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `jta` attribute value.
* `jta` attribute description: enable jakarta transactions integration
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=jta)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `max-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `max-pool-size` attribute value.
* `max-pool-size` attribute description: the `max-pool-size` element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. no more connections will be created in each `sub-pool`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=max-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `mcp`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `mcp` attribute value.
* `mcp` attribute description: defines the `managedconnectionpool` implementation, `f.ex`. `org.jboss.jca.core.connectionmanager.pool.mcp.semaphorearraylistmanagedconnectionpool`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=mcp)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `min-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `min-pool-size` attribute value.
* `min-pool-size` attribute description: the `min-pool-size` element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool

* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=new-connection-sql)`

* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `password` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-fair`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-fair` attribute value.
* `pool-fair` attribute description: defines if pool use should be fair
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-fair)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-prefill`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-prefill` attribute value.
* `pool-prefill` attribute description: should the pool be `prefilled`. changing this value can be done only on disabled `datasource`, requires a server restart otherwise.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-prefill)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-use-strict-min`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `pool-use-strict-min` attribute value.
* `pool-use-strict-min` attribute description: specifies if the `min-pool-size` should be considered strictly
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-use-strict-min)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `prepared-statements-cache-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `prepared-statements-cache-size` attribute value.
* `prepared-statements-cache-size` attribute description: the number of prepared statements per connection in an `lru` cache
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=prepared-statements-cache-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `query-timeout`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `query-timeout` attribute value.
