* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=query-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `reauth-plugin-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `reauth-plugin-class-name` attribute value.
* `reauth-plugin-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the reauthentication `plugin` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=reauth-plugin-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `reauth-plugin-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `reauth-plugin-properties` attribute value.
* `reauth-plugin-properties` attribute description: the properties for the reauthentication `plugin`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=reauth-plugin-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: specifies the `picketbox` security domain which defines the `picketbox` `javax.security.auth.subject` that are used to distinguish connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `set-tx-query-timeout`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `set-tx-query-timeout` attribute value.
* `set-tx-query-timeout` attribute description: whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout. any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=set-tx-query-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `share-prepared-statements`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `share-prepared-statements` attribute value.
* `share-prepared-statements` attribute description: whether to share prepared statements, `i.e`. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=share-prepared-statements)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `spy`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `spy` attribute value.
* `spy` attribute description: enable spying of `sql` statements
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=spy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-class-name` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionchecker` that provides an `isstaleconnection(sqlexception`) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionexception`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-module` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionchecker` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `stale-connection-checker-properties` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-properties` attribute description: the stale connection checker properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: define whether runtime statistics are enabled or not.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `track-statements`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `track-statements` attribute value.
* `track-statements` attribute description: whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool, result sets are closed, a statement is closed or return to the prepared statement cache. valid values are: "false" - do not track statements, "true" - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed, "`nowarn`" - track statements but do not warn about them being unclosed
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=track-statements)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `tracking`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `tracking` attribute value.
* `tracking` attribute description: defines if `ironjacamar` should track connection handles across transaction boundaries
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=tracking)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `transaction-isolation`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `transaction-isolation` attribute value.
* `transaction-isolation` attribute description: set the `java.sql.connection` transaction isolation level. valid values are: `transaction_read_uncommitted`, `transaction_read_committed`, `transaction_repeatable_read`, `transaction_serializable` and `transaction_none`. different values are used to set `customlevel` using `transactionisolation#customlevel`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=transaction-isolation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `url-delimiter`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `url-delimiter` attribute value.
* `url-delimiter` attribute description: specifies the delimiter for `urls` in `connection-url` for ha `datasources`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=url-delimiter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `url-selector-strategy-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `url-selector-strategy-class-name` attribute value.
* `url-selector-strategy-class-name` attribute description: a class that implements `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.urlselectorstrategy`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=url-selector-strategy-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `use-ccm`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `use-ccm` attribute value.
* `use-ccm` attribute description: enable the use of a cached connection manager
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-ccm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `use-fast-fail`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `use-fast-fail` attribute value.
* `use-fast-fail` attribute description: whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-fast-fail)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `use-java-context`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `use-java-context` attribute value.
* `use-java-context` attribute description: setting this to false will bind the `datasource` into global `jndi`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-java-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `use-try-lock`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `use-try-lock` attribute value.
* `use-try-lock` attribute description: any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-try-lock)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `user-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `user-name` attribute value.
* `user-name` attribute description: specify the user name used when creating a new connection
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=user-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-class-name` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.validconnectionchecker` that provides an `isvalidconnection(connection`) method to validate a connection. if an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. this overrides the `check-valid-connection-sql` element
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-module` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.validconnectionchecker` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `valid-connection-checker-properties` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-properties` attribute description: the valid connection checker properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `validate-on-match`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `validate-on-match` attribute value.
* `validate-on-match` attribute description: the `validate-on-match` element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. this is typically exclusive to the use of background validation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>:read-attribute(name=validate-on-match)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `datasources` `data-source` `connection-properties`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>/connection-properties=<connection-properties name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-properties` use '*' for `<connection-properties name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-properties` `value`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `data-source` `connection-properties` `value` attribute value.
* `value` attribute description: each `connection-property` specifies a string `name/value` pair with the property name coming from the name attribute and the value coming from the element content
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/data-source=<data-source name>/connection-properties=<connection-properties name>:read-attribute(name=value)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `datasources` `xa-data-source`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `datasources` `xa-data-source` use '*' for `<xa-data-source name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allocation-retry`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allocation-retry` attribute value.
* `allocation-retry` attribute description: the allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allocation-retry)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allocation-retry-wait-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allocation-retry-wait-millis` attribute value.
* `allocation-retry-wait-millis` attribute description: the allocation retry wait `millis` element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allocation-retry-wait-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allow-multiple-users`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `allow-multiple-users` attribute value.
* `allow-multiple-users` attribute description: specifies if multiple users will access the `datasource` through the `getconnection(user`, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=allow-multiple-users)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `authentication-context`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `authentication-context` attribute value.
* `authentication-context` attribute description: the elytron authentication context which defines the `javax.security.auth.subject` that is used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=authentication-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `background-validation`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `background-validation` attribute value.
* `background-validation` attribute description: an element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=background-validation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `background-validation-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `background-validation-millis` attribute value.
* `background-validation-millis` attribute description: the `background-validation-millis` element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=background-validation-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `blocking-timeout-wait-millis`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute value.
* `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute description: the `blocking-timeout-millis` element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=blocking-timeout-wait-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-decrementer-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-decrementer-class` attribute value.
* `capacity-decrementer-class` attribute description: class defining the policy for decrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-decrementer-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-decrementer-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-decrementer-properties` attribute value.
* `capacity-decrementer-properties` attribute description: properties to inject in class defining the policy for decrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-decrementer-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-incrementer-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-incrementer-class` attribute value.
* `capacity-incrementer-class` attribute description: class defining the policy for incrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-incrementer-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-incrementer-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute value.
* `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute description: properties to inject in class defining the policy for incrementing connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=capacity-incrementer-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `check-valid-connection-sql`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `check-valid-connection-sql` attribute value.
* `check-valid-connection-sql` attribute description: specify an `sql` statement to check validity of a pool connection. this may be called when managed connection is obtained from the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=check-valid-connection-sql)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connectable`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connectable` attribute value.
* `connectable` attribute description: enable the use of `cmr` for this `datasource`. this feature means that a local resource can reliably participate in an `xa` transaction.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connectable)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connection-listener-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connection-listener-class` attribute value.
* `connection-listener-class` attribute description: `speciefies` class name extending `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.spi.listener.connectionlistener` that provides a possible to listen for connection activation and passivation in order to perform actions before the connection is returned to the application or returned to the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connection-listener-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connection-listener-property`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `connection-listener-property` attribute value.
* `connection-listener-property` attribute description: properties to be injected in class specified in `connection-listener-class`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=connection-listener-property)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `credential-reference`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `credential-reference` attribute value.
* `credential-reference` attribute description: credential (from credential store) to authenticate on data source
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=credential-reference)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `driver-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `driver-name` attribute value.
* `driver-name` attribute description: defines the `jdbc` driver the `datasource` should use. it is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. in case the driver is deployed as a jar, the name is the name of the deployment unit
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=driver-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `elytron-enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `elytron-enabled` attribute value.
* `elytron-enabled` attribute description: enables elytron security for handling authentication of connections for recovery. the elytron `authentication-context` to be used will be current context if no context is specified (see `authentication-context`).
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=elytron-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `enabled` attribute value.
* `enabled` attribute description: specifies if the `datasource` should be enabled. note this attribute will not be supported runtime in next versions.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `enlistment-trace`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `enlistment-trace` attribute value.
* `enlistment-trace` attribute description: defines if `wildfly/ironjacamar` should record enlistment traces
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=enlistment-trace)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-class-name` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.exceptionsorter` that provides an `isexceptionfatal(sqlexception`) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-module` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.exceptionsorter` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `exception-sorter-properties` attribute value.
* `exception-sorter-properties` attribute description: the exception sorter properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=exception-sorter-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `flush-strategy`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `flush-strategy` attribute value.
* `flush-strategy` attribute description: specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=flush-strategy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `idle-timeout-minutes`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `idle-timeout-minutes` attribute value.
* `idle-timeout-minutes` attribute description: the `idle-timeout-minutes` elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. the actual maximum time depends also on the `idleremover` scan time, which is half of the smallest `idle-timeout-minutes` value of any pool. changing this value can be done only on disabled `datasource`, requires a server restart otherwise.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=idle-timeout-minutes)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `initial-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `initial-pool-size` attribute value.
* `initial-pool-size` attribute description: the `initial-pool-size` element indicates the initial number of connections a pool should hold.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=initial-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `interleaving`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `interleaving` attribute value.
* `interleaving` attribute description: an element to enable interleaving for `xa` connections
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=interleaving)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `jndi-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `jndi-name` attribute value.
* `jndi-name` attribute description: specifies the `jndi` name for the `datasource`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=jndi-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `max-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `max-pool-size` attribute value.
* `max-pool-size` attribute description: the `max-pool-size` element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. no more connections will be created in each `sub-pool`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=max-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `mcp`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `mcp` attribute value.
* `mcp` attribute description: defines the `managedconnectionpool` implementation, `f.ex`. `org.jboss.jca.core.connectionmanager.pool.mcp.semaphorearraylistmanagedconnectionpool`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=mcp)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `min-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `min-pool-size` attribute value.
* `min-pool-size` attribute description: the `min-pool-size` element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=min-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `new-connection-sql`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `new-connection-sql` attribute value.
* `new-connection-sql` attribute description: specifies an `sql` statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=new-connection-sql)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `no-recovery`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `no-recovery` attribute value.
* `no-recovery` attribute description: specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=no-recovery)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `no-tx-separate-pool`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `no-tx-separate-pool` attribute value.
* `no-tx-separate-pool` attribute description: oracle does not like `xa` connections getting used both inside and outside a jakarta transactions transaction. to `workaround` the problem you can create separate `sub-pools` for the different contexts
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=no-tx-separate-pool)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pad-xid`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pad-xid` attribute value.
* `pad-xid` attribute description: should the `xid` be padded
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pad-xid)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `password`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `password` attribute value.
* `password` attribute description: specifies the password used when creating a new connection
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-fair`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-fair` attribute value.
* `pool-fair` attribute description: defines if pool use should be fair
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-fair)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-prefill`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-prefill` attribute value.
* `pool-prefill` attribute description: should the pool be `prefilled`. changing this value can be done only on disabled `datasource`, requires a server restart otherwise.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-prefill)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-use-strict-min`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `pool-use-strict-min` attribute value.
* `pool-use-strict-min` attribute description: specifies if the `min-pool-size` should be considered strictly
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=pool-use-strict-min)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `prepared-statements-cache-size`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `prepared-statements-cache-size` attribute value.
* `prepared-statements-cache-size` attribute description: the number of prepared statements per connection in an `lru` cache
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=prepared-statements-cache-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `query-timeout`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `query-timeout` attribute value.
* `query-timeout` attribute description: any configured query timeout in seconds. if not provided no timeout will be set
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=query-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `reauth-plugin-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `reauth-plugin-class-name` attribute value.
* `reauth-plugin-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the reauthentication `plugin` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=reauth-plugin-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `reauth-plugin-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `reauth-plugin-properties` attribute value.
* `reauth-plugin-properties` attribute description: the properties for the reauthentication `plugin`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=reauth-plugin-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-authentication-context`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-authentication-context` attribute value.
* `recovery-authentication-context` attribute description: the elytron authentication context which defines the `javax.security.auth.subject` that is used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-authentication-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-credential-reference`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-credential-reference` attribute value.
* `recovery-credential-reference` attribute description: credential (from credential store) to authenticate on data source
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-credential-reference)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-elytron-enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-elytron-enabled` attribute value.
* `recovery-elytron-enabled` attribute description: enables elytron security for handling authentication of connections for recovery. the elytron `authentication-context` to be used will be current context if no context is specified (see `authentication-context`).
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-elytron-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-password`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-password` attribute value.
* `recovery-password` attribute description: the password used for recovery
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-plugin-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-plugin-class-name` attribute value.
* `recovery-plugin-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the recovery `plugin` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-plugin-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-plugin-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-plugin-properties` attribute value.
* `recovery-plugin-properties` attribute description: the properties for the recovery `plugin`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-plugin-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-security-domain`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-security-domain` attribute value.
* `recovery-security-domain` attribute description: the security domain used for recovery
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-username`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `recovery-username` attribute value.
* `recovery-username` attribute description: the user name used for recovery
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-username)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `same-rm-override`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `same-rm-override` attribute value.
* `same-rm-override` attribute description: the `is-same-rm-override` element allows one to unconditionally set whether the `javax.transaction.xa.xaresource.issamerm(xaresource`) returns true or false
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=same-rm-override)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: specifies the `picketbox` security domain which defines the `javax.security.auth.subject` that are used to distinguish connections in the pool
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `set-tx-query-timeout`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `set-tx-query-timeout` attribute value.
* `set-tx-query-timeout` attribute description: whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout. any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=set-tx-query-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `share-prepared-statements`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `share-prepared-statements` attribute value.
* `share-prepared-statements` attribute description: whether to share prepared statements, `i.e`. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=share-prepared-statements)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `spy`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `spy` attribute value.
* `spy` attribute description: enable spying of `sql` statements
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=spy)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-class-name` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionchecker` that provides an `isstaleconnection(sqlexception`) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionexception`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-module` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.staleconnectionchecker` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `stale-connection-checker-properties` attribute value.
* `stale-connection-checker-properties` attribute description: the stale connection checker properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=stale-connection-checker-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: define whether runtime statistics are enabled or not.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `track-statements`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `track-statements` attribute value.
* `track-statements` attribute description: whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool, result sets are closed, a statement is closed or return to the prepared statement cache. valid values are: "false" - do not track statements, "true" - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed, "`nowarn`" - track statements but do not warn about them being unclosed
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=track-statements)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `tracking`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `tracking` attribute value.
* `tracking` attribute description: defines if `ironjacamar` should track connection handles across transaction boundaries
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=tracking)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `transaction-isolation`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `transaction-isolation` attribute value.
* `transaction-isolation` attribute description: set the `java.sql.connection` transaction isolation level. valid values are: `transaction_read_uncommitted`, `transaction_read_committed`, `transaction_repeatable_read`, `transaction_serializable` and `transaction_none`. different values are used to set `customlevel` using `transactionisolation#customlevel`.
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=transaction-isolation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-delimiter`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-delimiter` attribute value.
* `url-delimiter` attribute description: specifies the delimiter for `urls` in `connection-url` for ha `datasources`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=url-delimiter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-property`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-property` attribute value.
* `url-property` attribute description: specifies the property for the `url` property in the `xa-datasource-property` values
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=url-property)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-selector-strategy-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `url-selector-strategy-class-name` attribute value.
* `url-selector-strategy-class-name` attribute description: a class that implements `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.urlselectorstrategy`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=url-selector-strategy-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-ccm`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-ccm` attribute value.
* `use-ccm` attribute description: enable the use of a cached connection manager
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-ccm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-fast-fail`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-fast-fail` attribute value.
* `use-fast-fail` attribute description: whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-fast-fail)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-java-context`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-java-context` attribute value.
* `use-java-context` attribute description: setting this to false will bind the `datasource` into global `jndi`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-java-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-try-lock`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `use-try-lock` attribute value.
* `use-try-lock` attribute description: any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=use-try-lock)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `user-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `user-name` attribute value.
* `user-name` attribute description: specify the user name used when creating a new connection
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=user-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-class-name`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-class-name` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-class-name` attribute description: an `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.validconnectionchecker` that provides an `isvalidconnection(connection`) method to validate a connection. if an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. this overrides the `check-valid-connection-sql` element
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-module`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-module` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-module` attribute description: the name of the module which makes the implementation of `org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.validconnectionchecker` available
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-properties`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `valid-connection-checker-properties` attribute value.
* `valid-connection-checker-properties` attribute description: the valid connection checker properties
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=valid-connection-checker-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `validate-on-match`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `validate-on-match` attribute value.
* `validate-on-match` attribute description: the `validate-on-match` element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. this is typically exclusive to the use of background validation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=validate-on-match)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `wrap-xa-resource`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `wrap-xa-resource` attribute value.
* `wrap-xa-resource` attribute description: should the `xaresource` instances be wrapped in an `org.jboss.tm.xaresourcewrapper` instance
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=wrap-xa-resource)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-class`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-class` attribute value.
* `xa-datasource-class` attribute description: the fully qualified name of the `javax.sql.xadatasource` implementation
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=xa-datasource-class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-resource-timeout`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-resource-timeout` attribute value.
* `xa-resource-timeout` attribute description: the value is passed to `xaresource.settransactiontimeout`(), in seconds. default is zero
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>:read-attribute(name=xa-resource-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-properties`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>/xa-datasource-properties=<xa-datasource-properties name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-properties` use '*' for `<xa-datasource-properties name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-properties` `value`
* Retrieve the `datasources` `xa-data-source` `xa-datasource-properties` `value` attribute value.
* `value` attribute description: specifies a property value to assign to the `xadatasource` implementation class. each property is identified by the name attribute and the property value is given by the `xa-datasource-property` element content. the property is mapped onto the `xadatasource` implementation by looking for a `javabeans` style getter method for the property name. if found, the value of the property is set using the `javabeans` setter with the element text translated to the true property type using the `java.beans.propertyeditor`
* operation: `/subsystem=datasources/xa-data-source=<xa-data-source name>/xa-datasource-properties=<xa-datasource-properties name>:read-attribute(name=value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `add-logging-api-dependencies`
* Retrieve the `logging` `add-logging-api-dependencies` attribute value.
* `add-logging-api-dependencies` attribute description: indicates whether or not logging `api` dependencies should be added to deployments during the deployment process. a value of true will add the dependencies to the deployment. a value of false will skip the deployment from being processed for logging `api` dependencies.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging:read-attribute(name=add-logging-api-dependencies)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `use-deployment-logging-config`
* Retrieve the `logging` `use-deployment-logging-config` attribute value.
* `use-deployment-logging-config` attribute description: indicates whether or not deployments should use a logging configuration file found in the deployment to configure the log manager. if set to true and a logging configuration file is found in the `deployment's` `meta-inf` or `web-inf/classes` directory, then a log manager will be configured with those settings. if set to false, the `server's` logging configuration will be used regardless of any logging configuration files supplied in the deployment.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging:read-attribute(name=use-deployment-logging-config)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler`
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` use '*' for `<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `append`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `append` attribute value.
* `append` attribute description: specify whether to append to the target file.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=append)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `autoflush`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `autoflush` attribute value.
* `autoflush` attribute description: automatically flush after each write.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=autoflush)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `enabled`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `enabled` attribute value.
* `enabled` attribute description: if set to true the handler is enabled and functioning as normal, if set to false the handler is ignored when processing log messages.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `encoding`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `encoding` attribute value.
* `encoding` attribute description: the character encoding used by this handler.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=encoding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `file`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `file` attribute value.
* `file` attribute description: the file description consisting of the path and optional relative to path.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=file)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `filter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `filter` attribute value.
* `filter` attribute description: defines a simple filter type.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=filter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `filter-spec`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `filter-spec` attribute value.
* `filter-spec` attribute description: a filter expression value to define a filter. example for a filter that does not match a pattern: `not(match("jbas`.*"))
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=filter-spec)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `formatter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `formatter` attribute value.
* `formatter` attribute description: defines a pattern for the formatter.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=formatter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `level`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `level` attribute value.
* `level` attribute description: the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this logger. message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=level)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `name`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `name` attribute value.
* `name` attribute description: the name of the handler.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `named-formatter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `named-formatter` attribute value.
* `named-formatter` attribute description: the name of the defined formatter to be used on the handler.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=named-formatter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `suffix`
* Retrieve the `logging` `periodic-rotating-file-handler` `suffix` attribute value.
* `suffix` attribute description: set the suffix string.  the string is in a format which can be understood by `java.text.simpledateformat`. the period of the rotation is automatically calculated based on the suffix.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/periodic-rotating-file-handler=<periodic-rotating-file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=suffix)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `logging` `json-formatter`
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `logging` `json-formatter` use '*' for `<json-formatter name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `date-format`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `date-format` attribute value.
* `date-format` attribute description: the `date/time` format pattern. the pattern must be a valid `java.time.format.datetimeformatter.ofpattern`() pattern. the default pattern is an `iso-8601` extended offset `date-time` format.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=date-format)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `exception-output-type`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `exception-output-type` attribute value.
* `exception-output-type` attribute description: indicates how the cause of the logged message, if one is available, will be added to the `json` output.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=exception-output-type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `key-overrides`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `key-overrides` attribute value.
* `key-overrides` attribute description: allows the names of the keys for the `json` properties to be overridden.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=key-overrides)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `meta-data`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `meta-data` attribute value.
* `meta-data` attribute description: sets the meta data to use in the `json` format. properties will be added to each log message.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=meta-data)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `pretty-print`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `pretty-print` attribute value.
* `pretty-print` attribute description: indicates whether or not pretty printing should be used when formatting.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=pretty-print)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `print-details`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `print-details` attribute value.
* `print-details` attribute description: sets whether or not details should be printed. printing the details can be expensive as the values are retrieved from the caller. the details include the source class name, source file name, source method name, source module name, source module version and source line number.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=print-details)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `record-delimiter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `record-delimiter` attribute value.
* `record-delimiter` attribute description: the value to be used to indicate the end of a record. if set to null no delimiter will be used at the end of the record. the default value is a line feed.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=record-delimiter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `json-formatter` `zone-id`
* Retrieve the `logging` `json-formatter` `zone-id` attribute value.
* `zone-id` attribute description: the zone id for formatting the date and time. the system default is used if left undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/json-formatter=<json-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=zone-id)`

* To get the list of all the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` use '*' for `<file-handler name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `append`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `append` attribute value.
* `append` attribute description: specify whether to append to the target file.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=append)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `autoflush`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `autoflush` attribute value.
* `autoflush` attribute description: automatically flush after each write.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=autoflush)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `enabled`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `enabled` attribute value.
* `enabled` attribute description: if set to true the handler is enabled and functioning as normal, if set to false the handler is ignored when processing log messages.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `encoding`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `encoding` attribute value.
* `encoding` attribute description: the character encoding used by this handler.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=encoding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `file`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `file` attribute value.
* `file` attribute description: the file description consisting of the path and optional relative to path.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=file)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `filter-spec`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `filter-spec` attribute value.
* `filter-spec` attribute description: a filter expression value to define a filter. example for a filter that does not match a pattern: `not(match("jbas`.*"))
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=filter-spec)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `formatter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `formatter` attribute value.
* `formatter` attribute description: defines a pattern for the formatter.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=formatter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `level`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `level` attribute value.
* `level` attribute description: the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this logger. message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logging-profile=<logging-profile name>/file-handler=<file-handler name>:read-attribute(name=level)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logging-profile` `file-handler` `name`

* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=meta-data)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `namespace-uri`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `namespace-uri` attribute value.
* `namespace-uri` attribute description: sets the `namespace` uri used for each record if `print-namespace` attribute is true. note that if no `namespace-uri` is defined and there are overridden keys no `namespace` will be written regardless if the `print-namespace` attribute is set to true.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=namespace-uri)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `pretty-print`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `pretty-print` attribute value.
* `pretty-print` attribute description: indicates whether or not pretty printing should be used when formatting.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=pretty-print)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `print-details`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `print-details` attribute value.
* `print-details` attribute description: sets whether or not details should be printed. printing the details can be expensive as the values are retrieved from the caller. the details include the source class name, source file name, source method name, source module name, source module version and source line number.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=print-details)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `print-namespace`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `print-namespace` attribute value.
* `print-namespace` attribute description: turns on or off the printing of the `namespace` for each <record/>. this is set to false by default.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=print-namespace)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `record-delimiter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `record-delimiter` attribute value.
* `record-delimiter` attribute description: the value to be used to indicate the end of a record. if set to null no delimiter will be used at the end of the record. the default value is a line feed.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=record-delimiter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `xml-formatter` `zone-id`
* Retrieve the `logging` `xml-formatter` `zone-id` attribute value.
* `zone-id` attribute description: the zone id for formatting the date and time. the system default is used if left undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/xml-formatter=<xml-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=zone-id)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `logging` `pattern-formatter`
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/pattern-formatter=<pattern-formatter name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `logging` `pattern-formatter` use '*' for `<pattern-formatter name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `pattern-formatter` `color-map`
* Retrieve the `logging` `pattern-formatter` `color-map` attribute value.
* `color-map` attribute description: the `color-map` attribute allows for a comma delimited list of colors to be used for different levels with a pattern formatter. the format for the color mapping pattern is `level-name:color-name.valid` levels; severe, fatal, error, warn, warning, info, debug, trace, `config`, fine, finer, finest valid colors; black, green, red, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, `brightblack`, `brightred`, `brightgreen`, `brightblue`, `brightyellow`, `brightmagenta`, `brightcyan`, `brightwhite`
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/pattern-formatter=<pattern-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=color-map)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `pattern-formatter` `pattern`
* Retrieve the `logging` `pattern-formatter` `pattern` attribute value.
* `pattern` attribute description: defines a pattern for the formatter.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/pattern-formatter=<pattern-formatter name>:read-attribute(name=pattern)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `logging` `logger`
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `logging` `logger` use '*' for `<logger name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `category`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `category` attribute value.
* `category` attribute description: specifies the category for the logger.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=category)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `filter`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `filter` attribute value.
* `filter` attribute description: defines a simple filter type.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=filter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `filter-spec`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `filter-spec` attribute value.
* `filter-spec` attribute description: a filter expression value to define a filter. example for a filter that does not match a pattern: `not(match("jbas`.*"))
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=filter-spec)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `handlers`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `handlers` attribute value.
* `handlers` attribute description: the handlers associated with the logger.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=handlers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `level`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `level` attribute value.
* `level` attribute description: the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by the logger. message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=level)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `logging` `logger` `use-parent-handlers`
* Retrieve the `logging` `logger` `use-parent-handlers` attribute value.
* `use-parent-handlers` attribute description: specifies whether or not this logger should send its output to its parent logger.
* operation: `/subsystem=logging/logger=<logger name>:read-attribute(name=use-parent-handlers)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `naming` `binding`
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `naming` `binding` use '*' for `<binding name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `binding-type`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `binding-type` attribute value.
* `binding-type` attribute description: the type of binding to create, may be simple, lookup, `external-context` or `object-factory`
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=binding-type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `cache`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `cache` attribute value.
* `cache` attribute description: if the external context should be cached
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `class`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `class` attribute value.
* `class` attribute description: the object factory class name for object factory bindings
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=class)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `environment`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `environment` attribute value.
* `environment` attribute description: the environment to use on object factory instance retrieval
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=environment)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `lookup`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `lookup` attribute value.
* `lookup` attribute description: the entry to lookup in `jndi` for lookup bindings
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=lookup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `module`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `module` attribute value.
* `module` attribute description: the module to load the object factory from for object factory bindings
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `type`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: the type of the value to bind for simple bindings, this must be a primitive type
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `naming` `binding` `value`
* Retrieve the `naming` `binding` `value` attribute value.
* `value` attribute description: the value to bind for simple bindings
* operation: `/subsystem=naming/binding=<binding name>:read-attribute(name=value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `modify-wsdl-address`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `modify-wsdl-address` attribute value.
* `modify-wsdl-address` attribute description: whether the soap address can be modified.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=modify-wsdl-address)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: whether statistics are to be gathered for endpoints, default value is 'false'.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `wsdl-host`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `wsdl-host` attribute value.
* `wsdl-host` attribute description: the `wsdl`, that is a required deployment artifact for an endpoint, has a <`soap:address`> element which points to the location of the endpoint. `jboss` supports rewriting of that soap address. if the content of <`soap:address`> is a valid `url`, `jbossws` will not rewrite it unless '`modify-wsdl-address`' is true. if the content of <`soap:address`> is not a valid `url`, `jbossws` will rewrite it using the attribute values given below. if '`wsdl-host`' is set to '`jbossws.undefined.host`', `jbossws` uses requesters host when rewriting the <`soap:address`>
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=wsdl-host)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `wsdl-path-rewrite-rule`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `wsdl-path-rewrite-rule` attribute value.
* `wsdl-path-rewrite-rule` attribute description: this string defines a sed substitution command (`e.g`., '`s/regexp/replacement/g`') that `jbossws` executes against the path component of each <`soap:address`> `url` published from the server. when `wsdl-path-rewrite-rule` is not defined, `jbossws` retains the original path component of each <`soap:address`> `url`. when '`modify-wsdl-address`' is set to "false" this element is ignored.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=wsdl-path-rewrite-rule)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `wsdl-port`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `wsdl-port` attribute value.
* `wsdl-port` attribute description: the `non-secure` port that will be used for rewriting the soap address. if absent the port will be identified by querying the list of installed connectors.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=wsdl-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `wsdl-secure-port`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `wsdl-secure-port` attribute value.
* `wsdl-secure-port` attribute description: the secure port that will be used for rewriting the soap address. if absent the port will be identified by querying the list of installed connectors.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=wsdl-secure-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `webservices` `wsdl-uri-scheme`
* Retrieve the `webservices` `wsdl-uri-scheme` attribute value.
* `wsdl-uri-scheme` attribute description: the uri scheme to use for rewriting <`soap:address`> . valid values are '`http`' and '`https`'. this configuration overrides scheme computed by processing the endpoint (even if a transport guarantee is specified). the provided values for '`wsdl-port`' and '`wsdl-secure-port`' (or their default values) are used depending on specified scheme.
* operation: `/subsystem=webservices:read-attribute(name=wsdl-uri-scheme)`

* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` use '*' for `<scanner name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-exploded`
* Retrieve the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-exploded` attribute value.
* `auto-deploy-exploded` attribute description: allows the automatic deployment of exploded content without requiring a .`dodeploy` marker file. recommended for only basic development scenarios to prevent exploded application deployment from occurring during changes by the developer or operating system.
* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-attribute(name=auto-deploy-exploded)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-xml`
* Retrieve the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-xml` attribute value.
* `auto-deploy-xml` attribute description: allows automatic deployment of `xml` content without requiring a .`dodeploy` marker file.
* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-attribute(name=auto-deploy-xml)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-zipped`
* Retrieve the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `auto-deploy-zipped` attribute value.
* `auto-deploy-zipped` attribute description: allows automatic deployment of zipped content without requiring a .`dodeploy` marker file.
* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-attribute(name=auto-deploy-zipped)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `deployment-timeout`
* Retrieve the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `deployment-timeout` attribute value.
* `deployment-timeout` attribute description: the time value in seconds for the deployment scanner to allow a deployment attempt before being cancelled.
* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-attribute(name=deployment-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `path`
* Retrieve the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `path` attribute value.
* `path` attribute description: the actual `filesystem` path to be scanned. treated as an absolute path, unless the '`relative-to`' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.
* operation: `/subsystem=deployment-scanner/scanner=<scanner name>:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `deployment-scanner` `scanner` `relative-to`

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `admin-objects` `enabled` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/config-properties=<config-properties name>:read-resource()`

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `config-properties` `value` attribute value.

* `allocation-retry` attribute description: the allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `allocation-retry-wait-millis`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `allocation-retry-wait-millis` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `authentication-context` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `authentication-context-and-application`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `authentication-context-and-application` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `background-validation` attribute value.
