## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `background-validation-millis`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `background-validation-millis` attribute value.
* `background-validation-millis` attribute description: the `background-validation-millis` element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. changing this value requires a server restart.

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute value.
* `blocking-timeout-wait-millis` attribute description: the `blocking-timeout-millis` element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=blocking-timeout-wait-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `capacity-decrementer-class`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `capacity-incrementer-properties`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute value.
* `capacity-incrementer-properties` attribute description: properties to inject in class defining the policy for incrementing connections in the pool.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `class-name`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `class-name` attribute value.
* `class-name` attribute description: specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `connectable`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `connectable` attribute value.
* `connectable` attribute description: enable the use of `cmr`. this feature means that a local resource can reliably participate in an `xa` transaction.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=connectable)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `elytron-enabled`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `elytron-enabled` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=elytron-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `enabled`

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `enlistment` attribute value.
* `enlistment` attribute description: defines if lazy enlistment should be used if supported by the resource adapter.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `enlistment-trace`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `idle-timeout-minutes`

* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=initial-pool-size)`

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `interleaving` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `no-recovery` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `pad-xid` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `pool-fair`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-credential-reference`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-credential-reference` attribute value.
* `recovery-credential-reference` attribute description: credential (from credential store) to authenticate on recovery connection
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-credential-reference)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-elytron-enabled`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-elytron-enabled` attribute value.
* `recovery-elytron-enabled` attribute description: indicates that an elytron authentication context will be used for recovery.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-elytron-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-password`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-password` attribute value.
* `recovery-password` attribute description: the password used for recovery.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-plugin-class-name`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-plugin-class-name` attribute value.
* `recovery-plugin-class-name` attribute description: the fully qualified class name of the recovery `plugin` implementation.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-plugin-class-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-plugin-properties`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-plugin-properties` attribute value.
* `recovery-plugin-properties` attribute description: the properties for the recovery `plugin`.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-plugin-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-security-domain`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-security-domain` attribute value.
* `recovery-security-domain` attribute description: the `picketbox` security domain used for recovery.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-username`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `recovery-username` attribute value.
* `recovery-username` attribute description: the user name used for recovery.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=recovery-username)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `same-rm-override`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `same-rm-override` attribute value.
* `same-rm-override` attribute description: using this attribute, you can unconditionally set whether `javax.transaction.xa.xaresource.issamerm(xaresource`) returns true or false.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=same-rm-override)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-application`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-application` attribute value.
* `security-application` attribute description: indicates that `application-supplied` parameters, such as from `getconnection(user`, `pw`), are used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=security-application)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: specifies the `picketbox` security domain which defines the `javax.security.auth.subject` that is used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-domain-and-application`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `security-domain-and-application` attribute value.
* `security-domain-and-application` attribute description: indicates that either `application-supplied` parameters, such as from `getconnection(user`, `pw`) are used to distinguish connections in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain-and-application)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `sharable`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `sharable` attribute value.
* `sharable` attribute description: enable the use of sharable connections, which allows lazy association to be enabled if supported.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=sharable)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `tracking`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `tracking` attribute value.
* `tracking` attribute description: defines if `ironjacamar` should track connection handles across transaction boundaries.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=tracking)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-ccm`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-ccm` attribute value.
* `use-ccm` attribute description: enable the use of a cached connection manager.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=use-ccm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-fast-fail`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-fast-fail` attribute value.
* `use-fast-fail` attribute description: whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false).
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=use-fast-fail)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-java-context`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `use-java-context` attribute value.
* `use-java-context` attribute description: setting this to false will bind the object into global `jndi`.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=use-java-context)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `validate-on-match`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `validate-on-match` attribute value.
* `validate-on-match` attribute description: this specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. this is typically exclusive to the use of background validation.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=validate-on-match)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `wrap-xa-resource`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `wrap-xa-resource` attribute value.
* `wrap-xa-resource` attribute description: specifies whether `xaresource` instances should be wrapped in an `org.jboss.tm.xaresourcewrapper` instance.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=wrap-xa-resource)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `xa-resource-timeout`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `xa-resource-timeout` attribute value.
* `xa-resource-timeout` attribute description: the value is passed to `xaresource.settransactiontimeout`(), in seconds.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>:read-attribute(name=xa-resource-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `config-properties`
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>/config-properties=<config-properties name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `config-properties` use '*' for `<config-properties name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `config-properties` `value`
* Retrieve the `resource-adapters` `resource-adapter` `connection-definitions` `config-properties` `value` attribute value.
* `value` attribute description: custom defined `config` property value.
* operation: `/subsystem=resource-adapters/resource-adapter=<resource-adapter name>/connection-definitions=<connection-definitions name>/config-properties=<config-properties name>:read-attribute(name=value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `jaxrs-2-0-request-matching`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `jaxrs-2-0-request-matching` attribute value.
* `jaxrs-2-0-request-matching` attribute description: in searching for a matching resource method with which to respond to a request, consider only resource methods with the best match for the request path.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=jaxrs-2-0-request-matching)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-add-charset`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-add-charset` attribute value.
* `resteasy-add-charset` attribute description: if a resource method returns a text/* or `application/xml`* media type without an explicit `charset`, `resteasy` will add "`charset=utf-8`" to the returned `content-type` header. note that the `charset` defaults to `utf-8` in this case, independent of the setting of this parameter.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-add-charset)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-buffer-exception-entity`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-buffer-exception-entity` attribute value.
* `resteasy-buffer-exception-entity` attribute description: upon receiving an exception, the client side buffers any response entity before closing the connection.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-buffer-exception-entity)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-disable-html-sanitizer`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-disable-html-sanitizer` attribute value.
* `resteasy-disable-html-sanitizer` attribute description: normally, a response with media type "`text/html`" and a status of `400` will be processed so that the characters "/", "<", ">", "&", """ (double quote), and "'" (single quote) are escaped to prevent an `xss` attack. setting this parameter to "true", escaping will not occur.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-disable-html-sanitizer)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-disable-providers`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-disable-providers` attribute value.
* `resteasy-disable-providers` attribute description: a comma delimited list of fully qualified provider class names that will be disabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-disable-providers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-expand-entity-references`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-expand-entity-references` attribute value.
* `resteasy-document-expand-entity-references` attribute description: expand external entities in `org.w3c.dom.document` documents and jakarta `xml` binding object representations.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-document-expand-entity-references)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-secure-disableDTDs`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-secure-disableDTDs` attribute value.
* `resteasy-document-secure-disableDTDs` attribute description: prohibit `dtds` in `org.w3c.dom.document` documents and jakarta `xml` binding object representations.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-document-secure-disableDTDs)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-secure-processing-feature`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-document-secure-processing-feature` attribute value.
* `resteasy-document-secure-processing-feature` attribute description: impose security constraints in processing `org.w3c.dom.document` documents and jakarta `xml` binding object representations.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-document-secure-processing-feature)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-gzip-max-input`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-gzip-max-input` attribute value.
* `resteasy-gzip-max-input` attribute description: imposes maximum size on decompressed `gzipped`.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-gzip-max-input)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-jndi-resources`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-jndi-resources` attribute value.
* `resteasy-jndi-resources` attribute description: a comma delimited list of `jndi` names which reference objects to be registered as jakarta restful web services resources.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-jndi-resources)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-language-mappings`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-language-mappings` attribute value.
* `resteasy-language-mappings` attribute description: replaces the need for an `accept-language` header by mapping file name extensions (like .en or .fr) to a language. used when the client is unable to use an `accept-language` header to choose a language (`i.e`. a browser).
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-language-mappings)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-media-type-mappings`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-media-type-mappings` attribute value.
* `resteasy-media-type-mappings` attribute description: replaces the need for an accept header by mapping file name extensions (like .`xml` or .txt) to a media type. used when the client is unable to use an accept header to choose a representation (`i.e`. a browser).
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-media-type-mappings)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-media-type-param-mapping`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-media-type-param-mapping` attribute value.
* `resteasy-media-type-param-mapping` attribute description: names a query parameter that can be set to an acceptable media type, enabling content negotiation without an accept header.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-media-type-param-mapping)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-patchfilter-disabled`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-patchfilter-disabled` attribute value.
* `resteasy-patchfilter-disabled` attribute description: specifies that `json` patch and `json` merge patch functionalities are all disabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-patchfilter-disabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-prefer-jackson-over-jsonb`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-prefer-jackson-over-jsonb` attribute value.
* `resteasy-prefer-jackson-over-jsonb` attribute description: specifies that the jackson `json` provider should be preferred over the default jakarta `json` processing provider for `json` binding.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-prefer-jackson-over-jsonb)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-providers`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-providers` attribute value.
* `resteasy-providers` attribute description: a comma delimited list of fully qualified @provider class names you want to register.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-providers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-rfc7232preconditions`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-rfc7232preconditions` attribute value.
* `resteasy-rfc7232preconditions` attribute description: enables `rfc7232` compliant `http` preconditions handling.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-rfc7232preconditions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-role-based-security`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-role-based-security` attribute value.
* `resteasy-role-based-security` attribute description: enables role based security.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-role-based-security)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-secure-random-max-use`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-secure-random-max-use` attribute value.
* `resteasy-secure-random-max-use` attribute description: the number of times a `securerandom` can be used before reseeding.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-secure-random-max-use)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-use-builtin-providers`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-use-builtin-providers` attribute value.
* `resteasy-use-builtin-providers` attribute description: whether or not to register default, `built-in` @provider classes.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-use-builtin-providers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-use-container-form-params`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-use-container-form-params` attribute value.
* `resteasy-use-container-form-params` attribute description: `httpservletrequest.getparametermap`(). use this switch if you are calling this method within a `servlet` filter or consuming the input stream within the filter.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-use-container-form-params)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `resteasy-wider-request-matching`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `resteasy-wider-request-matching` attribute value.
* `resteasy-wider-request-matching` attribute description: turns off the jakarta restful web services spec defined `class-level` expression filtering and instead tries to match every `method's` full path.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=resteasy-wider-request-matching)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `tracing-threshold`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `tracing-threshold` attribute value.
* `tracing-threshold` attribute description: the "summary" threshold will emit some brief tracing information. the "trace" threshold will produce more detailed tracing information, and the "verbose" threshold will generate extremely detailed tracing information.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=tracing-threshold)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `jaxrs` `tracing-type`
* Retrieve the `jaxrs` `tracing-type` attribute value.
* `tracing-type` attribute description: "all" will enable the tracing feature. "`on_demand`" mode will give control to the client side: a client can send a tracing request via `http` header and get the tracing info back from response headers. "off" mode will disable the tracing feature, and this is the default mode. note that it is suggested this is set to "off" for production servers.
* operation: `/subsystem=jaxrs:read-attribute(name=tracing-type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `annotation-property-replacement`
* Retrieve the `ee` `annotation-property-replacement` attribute value.
* `annotation-property-replacement` attribute description: flag indicating whether jakarta ee annotations will have property replacements applied
* operation: `/subsystem=ee:read-attribute(name=annotation-property-replacement)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `ear-subdeployments-isolated`
* Retrieve the `ee` `ear-subdeployments-isolated` attribute value.
* `ear-subdeployments-isolated` attribute description: flag indicating whether each of the `subdeployments` within a .ear can access classes belonging to another `subdeployment` within the same .ear. a value of false means the `subdeployments` can see classes belonging to other `subdeployments` within the .ear.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee:read-attribute(name=ear-subdeployments-isolated)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `global-modules`
* Retrieve the `ee` `global-modules` attribute value.
* `global-modules` attribute description: a list of modules that should be made available to all deployments.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee:read-attribute(name=global-modules)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `jboss-descriptor-property-replacement`
* Retrieve the `ee` `jboss-descriptor-property-replacement` attribute value.
* `jboss-descriptor-property-replacement` attribute description: flag indicating whether `jboss` specific deployment descriptors will have property replacements applied
* operation: `/subsystem=ee:read-attribute(name=jboss-descriptor-property-replacement)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `spec-descriptor-property-replacement`
* Retrieve the `ee` `spec-descriptor-property-replacement` attribute value.
* `spec-descriptor-property-replacement` attribute description: flag indicating whether descriptors defined by the jakarta ee specification will have property replacements applied
* operation: `/subsystem=ee:read-attribute(name=spec-descriptor-property-replacement)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service`
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` use '*' for `<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `active-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `active-thread-count` attribute value.
* `active-thread-count` attribute description: the approximate number of threads that are actively executing tasks.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=active-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `completed-task-count`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `completed-task-count` attribute value.
* `completed-task-count` attribute description: the approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=completed-task-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `context-service`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `context-service` attribute value.
* `context-service` attribute description: the name of the context service to be used by the scheduled executor.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=context-service)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `core-threads`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `core-threads` attribute value.
* `core-threads` attribute description: the number of threads to be used by the scheduled executor, even if they are idle. if this is not defined or is set to `0`, the core pool size will be calculated based on the number of available processors.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=core-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `current-queue-size`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `current-queue-size` attribute value.
* `current-queue-size` attribute description: the current size of the `executor's` task queue.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=current-queue-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-task-termination-period`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-task-termination-period` attribute value.
* `hung-task-termination-period` attribute description: the period, in milliseconds, for attempting hung tasks automatic termination, by cancelling such tasks, and interrupting their executing threads. if value is `0`, which is the default, hung tasks are never cancelled.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=hung-task-termination-period)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-task-threshold`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-task-threshold` attribute value.
* `hung-task-threshold` attribute description: the runtime, in milliseconds, for tasks to be considered hung by the scheduled executor. if `0` tasks are never considered hung.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=hung-task-threshold)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `hung-thread-count` attribute value.
* `hung-thread-count` attribute description: the number of executor threads that are hung.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=hung-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `jndi-name`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `jndi-name` attribute value.
* `jndi-name` attribute description: the `jndi` name to lookup the managed scheduled executor service.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=jndi-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `keepalive-time`
* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-scheduled-executor-service` `keepalive-time` attribute value.
* `keepalive-time` attribute description: when the number of threads is greater than the core, this is the maximum time, in milliseconds, that excess idle threads will wait for new tasks before terminating.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/managed-scheduled-executor-service=<managed-scheduled-executor-service name>:read-attribute(name=keepalive-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ee` `global-directory`
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/global-directory=<global-directory name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ee` `global-directory` use '*' for `<global-directory name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `global-directory` `path`
* Retrieve the `ee` `global-directory` `path` attribute value.
* `path` attribute description: the path of the directory to scan. it is treated as an absolute path, unless the '`relative-to`' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path. if treated as an absolute path, the actual runtime pathname specified by the value of this attribute will be determined as follows: if this value is already absolute, then the value is directly used. otherwise, the runtime pathname is resolved in a `system-dependent` way.  on unix systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current user directory. on `microsoft` windows systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current directory of the drive named by the pathname, if any; if not, it is resolved against the current user directory.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/global-directory=<global-directory name>:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ee` `global-directory` `relative-to`
* Retrieve the `ee` `global-directory` `relative-to` attribute value.
* `relative-to` attribute description: the name of another previously named path, or one of the standard paths provided by the system. if '`relative-to`' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. the standard paths provided by the system include: `jboss.home` - the root directory of the `jboss` as distribution, `user.home` - `user's` home directory, `user.dir` - `user's` current working directory, `java.home` - java installation directory, `jboss.server.base.dir` - root directory for an individual server instance, `jboss.server.data.dir` - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage, `jboss.server.log.dir` - directory the server will use for log file storage, `jboss.server.tmp.dir` - directory the server will use for temporary file storage, and `jboss.domain.servers.dir` - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances.
* operation: `/subsystem=ee/global-directory=<global-directory name>:read-attribute(name=relative-to)`

* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-executor-service` `max-threads` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `ee` `managed-executor-service` `queue-length` attribute value.
* `queue-length` attribute description: the executors task queue capacity. a length of `0` means direct `hand-off` and possible rejection will occur. an undefined length (the default), or `integer.max_value`, indicates that an unbounded queue should be used. all other values specify an exact queue size. if an unbounded queue or direct `hand-off` is used, a `core-threads` value greater than zero is required.

## syntax of the operation to get the `remoting` `max-outbound-messages`

* To get the list of all the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` use '*' for `<mapped-regex-realm-mapper name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `delegate-realm-mapper`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `delegate-realm-mapper` attribute value.
* `delegate-realm-mapper` attribute description: the `realmmapper` to delegate to if the pattern does not match. if no delegate is specified then the default realm on the domain will be used instead. if the `username` does not match the pattern and a delegate `realm-mapper` is present, the result of `delegate-realm-mapper` is mapped via the `realm-map`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/mapped-regex-realm-mapper=<mapped-regex-realm-mapper name>:read-attribute(name=delegate-realm-mapper)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `pattern`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `pattern` attribute value.
* `pattern` attribute description: the regular expression which must contain at least one capture group to extract the realm from the name. if the regular expression matches more than one capture group, the first capture group is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/mapped-regex-realm-mapper=<mapped-regex-realm-mapper name>:read-attribute(name=pattern)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `realm-map`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `mapped-regex-realm-mapper` `realm-map` attribute value.
* `realm-map` attribute description: mapping of realm name extracted using the regular expression to a defined realm name. if the value for the mapping is not in the map or the realm whose name is the result of the mapping does not exist in the given security domain, the default realm is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/mapped-regex-realm-mapper=<mapped-regex-realm-mapper name>:read-attribute(name=realm-map)`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `dir-context` `url` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` use '*' for `<kerberos-security-factory name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `debug`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `debug` attribute value.
* `debug` attribute description: should the `jaas` step of obtaining the credential have debug logging enabled.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=debug)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `fail-cache`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `fail-cache` attribute value.
* `fail-cache` attribute description: amount of seconds before new try to obtain server credential should be done if it has failed last time.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=fail-cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `mechanism-names`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `mechanism-names` attribute value.
* `mechanism-names` attribute description: the mechanism names the credential should be usable with. names will be converted to `oids` and used together with `oids` from `mechanism-oids` attribute.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=mechanism-names)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `mechanism-oids`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `mechanism-oids` attribute value.
* `mechanism-oids` attribute description: the mechanism `oids` the credential should be usable with. will be used together with `oids` derived from names from `mechanism-names` attribute.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=mechanism-oids)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `minimum-remaining-lifetime`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `minimum-remaining-lifetime` attribute value.
* `minimum-remaining-lifetime` attribute description: how much lifetime (in seconds) should a cached credential have remaining before it is recreated.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=minimum-remaining-lifetime)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `obtain-kerberos-ticket`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `obtain-kerberos-ticket` attribute value.
* `obtain-kerberos-ticket` attribute description: should the `kerberosticket` also be obtained and associated with the credential. this is required to be true where credentials are delegated to the server.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=obtain-kerberos-ticket)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `options`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `options` attribute value.
* `options` attribute description: the `krb5loginmodule` additional options.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=options)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `path`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `path` attribute value.
* `path` attribute description: the path of the `keytab` to load to obtain the credential.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `principal`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `principal` attribute value.
* `principal` attribute description: the principal represented by the `keytab`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=principal)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `relative-to`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `relative-to` attribute value.
* `relative-to` attribute description: the name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. if '`relative-to`' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=relative-to)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `request-lifetime`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `request-lifetime` attribute value.
* `request-lifetime` attribute description: how much lifetime (in seconds) should be requested for newly created credentials.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=request-lifetime)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `required`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `required` attribute value.
* `required` attribute description: is the `keytab` file with adequate principal required to exist at the time the service starts?
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=required)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `server`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `server` attribute value.
* `server` attribute description: if this for use server side or client side?
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=server)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `wrap-gss-credential`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `kerberos-security-factory` `wrap-gss-credential` attribute value.
* `wrap-gss-credential` attribute description: should generated `gss` credentials be wrapped to prevent improper disposal or not?
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/kerberos-security-factory=<kerberos-security-factory name>:read-attribute(name=wrap-gss-credential)`

* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-resource()`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `anonymous` attribute value.
* `anonymous` attribute description: enables anonymous authentication.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=anonymous)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `authentication-name`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `authentication-name` attribute value.
* `authentication-name` attribute description: the authentication name to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=authentication-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `authorization-name`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `authorization-name` attribute value.
* `authorization-name` attribute description: the authorization name to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=authorization-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `credential-reference`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `credential-reference` attribute value.
* `credential-reference` attribute description: the reference to credential stored in `credentialstore` under defined alias or clear text password.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `extends`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `extends` attribute value.
* `extends` attribute description: a previously defined authentication configuration to extend.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=extends)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `forwarding-mode`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `forwarding-mode` attribute value.
* `forwarding-mode` attribute description: the type of security identity forwarding to use. a mode of 'authentication' forwarding forwards the principal and credential. a mode of 'authorization' forwards the authorization id, allowing for a different authentication identity.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=forwarding-mode)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `host`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `host` attribute value.
* `host` attribute description: the host to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=host)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `kerberos-security-factory`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `kerberos-security-factory` attribute value.
* `kerberos-security-factory` attribute description: reference to a `kerberos` security factory used to obtain a `gss` `kerberos` credential
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=kerberos-security-factory)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `mechanism-properties`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `mechanism-properties` attribute value.
* `mechanism-properties` attribute description: configuration properties for the `sasl` authentication mechanism.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=mechanism-properties)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `port`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `port` attribute value.
* `port` attribute description: the port to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `protocol`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `protocol` attribute value.
* `protocol` attribute description: the protocol to use.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `realm`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `realm` attribute value.
* `realm` attribute description: the realm to use.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=realm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `sasl-mechanism-selector`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `sasl-mechanism-selector` attribute value.
* `sasl-mechanism-selector` attribute description: the `sasl` mechanism selector string.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=sasl-mechanism-selector)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: reference to a security domain to obtain a forwarded identity.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `webservices`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `authentication-configuration` `webservices` attribute value.
* `webservices` attribute description: web services client configuration definition.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/authentication-configuration=<authentication-configuration name>:read-attribute(name=webservices)`

* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/custom-principal-decoder=<custom-principal-decoder name>:read-resource()`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `custom-principal-decoder` `class-name` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `custom-principal-decoder` `configuration`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `custom-principal-decoder` `configuration` attribute value.
* `configuration` attribute description: the optional `kay/value` configuration for the principal decoder
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/custom-principal-decoder=<custom-principal-decoder name>:read-attribute(name=configuration)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `custom-principal-decoder` `module`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `custom-principal-decoder` `module` attribute value.
* `module` attribute description: name of the module to use to load the principal decoder
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/custom-principal-decoder=<custom-principal-decoder name>:read-attribute(name=module)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron` `identity-realm`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/identity-realm=<identity-realm name>:read-resource()`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `identity-realm` `attribute-name` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `identity-realm` `attribute-values`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `identity-realm` `attribute-values` attribute value.
* `attribute-values` attribute description: the values associated with the identity attributes.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/identity-realm=<identity-realm name>:read-attribute(name=attribute-values)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `identity-realm` `identity`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `identity-realm` `identity` attribute value.
* `identity` attribute description: the name of the identity available from the security realm.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/identity-realm=<identity-realm name>:read-attribute(name=identity)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `default-resolver`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `default-resolver` attribute value.
* `default-resolver` attribute description: the default expression resolver to use if not specified within the expression.  if not set there is no default.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/expression=encryption:read-attribute(name=default-resolver)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `prefix`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `prefix` attribute value.
* `prefix` attribute description: the prefix in use for encrypted expressions.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/expression=encryption:read-attribute(name=prefix)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `resolvers`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `expression` `encryption` `resolvers` attribute value.
* `resolvers` attribute description: list of expressions resolver definitions.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/expression=encryption:read-attribute(name=resolvers)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron` `jaas-realm`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron` `jaas-realm` use '*' for `<jaas-realm name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `callback-handler`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `callback-handler` attribute value.
* `callback-handler` attribute description: callback handler to use with the login context. security property "`auth.login.defaultcallbackhandler`" can be used instead. the default callback handler of the realm will be used if none of these are defined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-attribute(name=callback-handler)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `entry`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `entry` attribute value.
* `entry` attribute description: `jaas` configuration file entry name.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-attribute(name=entry)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `module`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `module` attribute value.
* `module` attribute description: the module to use to obtain the `classloader` to load the custom `loginmodules` and custom `callbackhandler`. the `classloader` that loads the resource will be used if none defined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-attribute(name=module)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `path`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `path` attribute value.
* `path` attribute description: path to the `jaas` login context configuration file. you can also specify the location of the configuration with java system property "`java.security.auth.login.config`" or with java security property "`login.config.url`".
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `relative-to`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `jaas-realm` `relative-to` attribute value.
* `relative-to` attribute description: the base path of the `jaas` configuration file.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/jaas-realm=<jaas-realm name>:read-attribute(name=relative-to)`

* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron` `file-audit-log` use '*' for `<file-audit-log name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `autoflush`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `autoflush` attribute value.
* `autoflush` attribute description: whether every event should be immediately flushed to disk (if undefined will default to the value of synchronized).
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=autoflush)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `encoding`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `encoding` attribute value.
* `encoding` attribute description: the audit file encoding. default is `utf_8`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=encoding)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `format`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `format` attribute value.
* `format` attribute description: the format to use to record the audit event.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=format)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `path`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `path` attribute value.
* `path` attribute description: path of the file to be written.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `relative-to`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `relative-to` attribute value.
* `relative-to` attribute description: the relative path to the audit log.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=relative-to)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `synchronized`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `file-audit-log` `synchronized` attribute value.
* `synchronized` attribute description: whether every event should be immediately synchronised to disk.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/file-audit-log=<file-audit-log name>:read-attribute(name=synchronized)`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `custom-realm-mapper` `configuration` attribute value.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `custom-realm-mapper` `module`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `custom-realm-mapper` `module` attribute value.
* `module` attribute description: name of the module to use to load the `realmmapper`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/custom-realm-mapper=<custom-realm-mapper name>:read-attribute(name=module)`

* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/aggregate-role-decoder=<aggregate-role-decoder name>:read-resource()`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `aggregate-role-decoder` `role-decoders` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/trust-manager=<trust-manager name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron` `trust-manager` use '*' for `<trust-manager name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `algorithm` attribute value.
* `algorithm` attribute description: the name of the algorithm to use to create the underlying `trustmanagerfactory`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/trust-manager=<trust-manager name>:read-attribute(name=algorithm)`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `alias-filter` attribute value.
* `alias-filter` attribute description: a filter to apply to the aliases returned from the `keystore`, can either be a comma separated list of aliases to return or one of the following formats `all:-alias1:-alias2`, `none:+alias1:+alias2`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `certificate-revocation-list`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `certificate-revocation-list` attribute value.
* `certificate-revocation-list` attribute description: enables certificate revocation list checks to a trust manager.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/trust-manager=<trust-manager name>:read-attribute(name=certificate-revocation-list)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `certificate-revocation-lists`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `certificate-revocation-lists` attribute value.
* `certificate-revocation-lists` attribute description: enables certificate revocation list checks to a trust manager using multiple certificate revocation lists.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/trust-manager=<trust-manager name>:read-attribute(name=certificate-revocation-lists)`

* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `key-store` attribute value.
* `key-store` attribute description: reference to the `keystore` to use to initialise the underlying `trustmanagerfactory`.

* `maximum-cert-path` attribute description: the maximum number of `non-self-issued` intermediate certificates that may exist in a certification path for `ocsp` and crl checks. if neither `ocsp` and crl is configured, this attribute has no effect.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `ocsp`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `ocsp` attribute value.
* `ocsp` attribute description: enables online certificate status protocol checks to a trust manager.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron/trust-manager=<trust-manager name>:read-attribute(name=ocsp)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `provider-name`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron` `trust-manager` `providers`
* Retrieve the `elytron` `trust-manager` `providers` attribute value.
* `providers` attribute description: reference to obtain the provider[] to use when creating the underlying `trustmanagerfactory`.

* Retrieve the `elytron` `key-store` `type` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=keepalive-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `largest-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `largest-thread-count` attribute value.
* `largest-thread-count` attribute description: the largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=largest-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `max-threads`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `max-threads` attribute value.
* `max-threads` attribute description: the maximum thread pool size. note this should always be greater than `3`. two threads are reserved to ensure partition jobs can execute as expected.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=max-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `name`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `name` attribute value.
* `name` attribute description: the name of the thread pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `queue-size`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `queue-size` attribute value.
* `queue-size` attribute description: the queue size.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=queue-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `rejected-count`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `rejected-count` attribute value.
* `rejected-count` attribute description: the number of tasks that have been rejected.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=rejected-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `task-count`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `task-count` attribute value.
* `task-count` attribute description: the approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=task-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `thread-factory`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-pool` `thread-factory` attribute value.
* `thread-factory` attribute description: specifies the name of a specific thread factory to use to create worker threads. if not defined an appropriate default thread factory will be used.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=thread-factory)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `batch-jberet` `thread-factory`
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-factory=<thread-factory name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` use '*' for `<thread-factory name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `group-name`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `group-name` attribute value.
* `group-name` attribute description: specifies the name of a  thread group to create for this thread factory.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-factory=<thread-factory name>:read-attribute(name=group-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `name`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `name` attribute value.
* `name` attribute description: the name of the created thread factory.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-factory=<thread-factory name>:read-attribute(name=name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `priority`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `priority` attribute value.
* `priority` attribute description: may be used to specify the thread priority of created threads.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-factory=<thread-factory name>:read-attribute(name=priority)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `thread-name-pattern`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `thread-factory` `thread-name-pattern` attribute value.
* `thread-name-pattern` attribute description: the template used to create names for threads.  the following patterns may be used:
%% - emit a percent sign
%t - emit the `per-factory` thread sequence number
%g - emit the global thread sequence number
%f - emit the factory sequence number
%i - emit the thread id.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/thread-factory=<thread-factory name>:read-attribute(name=thread-name-pattern)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository`
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/jdbc-job-repository=<jdbc-job-repository name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository` use '*' for `<jdbc-job-repository name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository` `data-source`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository` `data-source` attribute value.
* `data-source` attribute description: the data source name used to connect to the database.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/jdbc-job-repository=<jdbc-job-repository name>:read-attribute(name=data-source)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository` `execution-records-limit`
* Retrieve the `batch-jberet` `jdbc-job-repository` `execution-records-limit` attribute value.
* `execution-records-limit` attribute description: the maximum number of job execution records that should be returned by the job repository.
* operation: `/subsystem=batch-jberet/jdbc-job-repository=<jdbc-job-repository name>:read-attribute(name=execution-records-limit)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-liveness-checks-status`
* Retrieve the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-liveness-checks-status` attribute value.
* `empty-liveness-checks-status` attribute description: defines the global status returned by the health checks endpoints if no liveness probes have been defined in deployments.
* operation: `/subsystem=microprofile-health-smallrye:read-attribute(name=empty-liveness-checks-status)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-readiness-checks-status`
* Retrieve the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-readiness-checks-status` attribute value.
* `empty-readiness-checks-status` attribute description: defines the global status returned by the health checks endpoints if no readiness probes have been defined in deployments.
* operation: `/subsystem=microprofile-health-smallrye:read-attribute(name=empty-readiness-checks-status)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-startup-checks-status`
* Retrieve the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `empty-startup-checks-status` attribute value.
* `empty-startup-checks-status` attribute description: defines the global status returned by the health checks endpoints if no startup probes have been defined in deployments.
* operation: `/subsystem=microprofile-health-smallrye:read-attribute(name=empty-startup-checks-status)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `security-enabled`
* Retrieve the `microprofile-health-smallrye` `security-enabled` attribute value.
* `security-enabled` attribute description: true if authentication is required to access the `http` endpoints on the `http` management interface.
* operation: `/subsystem=microprofile-health-smallrye:read-attribute(name=security-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `provider`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` use '*' for `<provider name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `allow-any-hostname`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `allow-any-hostname` attribute value.
* `allow-any-hostname` attribute description: if set to 'true', `hostname` verification is skipped when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this can be useful in testing environments. this should never be set to 'true' in production environments as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=allow-any-hostname)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `always-refresh-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `always-refresh-token` attribute value.
* `always-refresh-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem refreshes the token every time your application receives a web request, and a new request is sent to the `openid` provider to obtain a new access token. this can result in a higher load on the `openid` provider and may impact the performance of the application.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=always-refresh-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `auth-server-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `auth-server-url` attribute value.
* `auth-server-url` attribute description: the base `url` of the `keycloak` authorization server. this is `keycloak-specific`. it is recommended to use the '`provider-url`' instead.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=auth-server-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `autodetect-bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute value.
* `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute description: whether to `auto-detect` soap or rest clients based on headers like '`x-requested-with`', '`soapaction`' or 'accept'. if set to 'true', the subsystem sends an `http` `401` status code to unauthenticated soap or rest clients instead of redirecting them to the `openid` provider login page. set the value to 'true' if your application serves both applications and web services.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=autodetect-bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-keystore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-keystore` attribute value.
* `client-keystore` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` to use when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore`. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `confidential-port`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `confidential-port` attribute value.
* `confidential-port` attribute description: the confidential port used by the `openid` provider when communicating securely over `ssl/tls`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=confidential-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-pool-size` attribute value.
* `connection-pool-size` attribute description: the connection pool size to use when communicating with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=connection-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for establishing a connection with the remote host in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=connection-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-ttl-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `connection-ttl-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-ttl-millis` attribute description: the amount of time in milliseconds for the connection to be kept alive. a value less than or equal to zero is interpreted as an infinite value.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=connection-ttl-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-allowed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-allowed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-allowed-methods`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-allowed-methods` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-methods` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-methods`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-methods)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-exposed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-exposed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-exposed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-expose-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=cors-exposed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-max-age`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `cors-max-age` attribute value.
* `cors-max-age` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-max-age`' header. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=cors-max-age)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `disable-trust-manager`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `disable-trust-manager` attribute value.
* `disable-trust-manager` attribute description: whether or not to make use of a trust manager when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional. this should be set to 'true' only during development and never in production as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=disable-trust-manager)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `enable-cors`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `enable-cors` attribute value.
* `enable-cors` attribute description: enable the `keycloak` `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) support. this is optional. this is `keycloak-specific`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=enable-cors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `expose-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `expose-token` attribute value.
* `expose-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', an authenticated browser client can obtain the signed access token (through a `javascript` `http` invocation) via the `url` '`root/k_query_bearer_token`'. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=expose-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter`
