* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute value.
* `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute description: disable query parameter parsing for the '`access_token`'. users will not be able to authenticate if they only pass in an '`access_token`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=ignore-oauth-query-parameter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `principal-attribute`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `principal-attribute` attribute value.
* `principal-attribute` attribute description: indicates which value from the id token to use as the principal for the identity. the principal defaults to the value of the 'sub' if the token attribute is null.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=principal-attribute)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `provider-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `provider-url` attribute value.
* `provider-url` attribute description: the `openid` provider `url`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=provider-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `proxy-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `proxy-url` attribute value.
* `proxy-url` attribute description: the `url` for the `http` proxy if one is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `realm-public-key`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `realm-public-key` attribute value.
* `realm-public-key` attribute description: the public key of the `openid` provider in `pem` format. this is optional. it is not recommended to set it. if the public key is not set, the subsystem downloads the public key from the `openid` provider when needed. if the public key is set, the subsystem never downloads new keys from the `openid` provider, breaking the subsystem when the `openid` provider rotates its keys.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=realm-public-key)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `register-node-at-startup`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `register-node-at-startup` attribute value.
* `register-node-at-startup` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem sends a registration request to the `openid` provider. this attribute is useful only when your application is clustered.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-at-startup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `register-node-period`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `register-node-period` attribute value.
* `register-node-period` attribute description: if '`register-node-at-startup`' is set to 'true', this specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which the node should be `re-registered`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-period)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `socket-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `socket-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `socket-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for the socket waiting for data after establishing the connection in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=socket-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `ssl-required`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `ssl-required` attribute value.
* `ssl-required` attribute description: whether the communication with the `openid` provider should be over `https`. valid values are: 'all' - to always require `https`, 'external' - to only require `https` for external requests, 'none' - if `https` is not required. this should be set to 'all' in production environments.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-required)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `token-signature-algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `token-signature-algorithm` attribute value.
* `token-signature-algorithm` attribute description: the token signature algorithm used by the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=token-signature-algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `token-store`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `token-store` attribute value.
* `token-store` attribute description: defines whether to store account information in an `http` session or in a cookie.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=token-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `truststore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `truststore` attribute value.
* `truststore` attribute description: the path to the `truststore` to use when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. prefix the path with '`classpath`:' to obtain the `truststore` from the `deployment's` `classpath`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=truststore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `truststore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `truststore-password` attribute value.
* `truststore-password` attribute description: the password for the `truststore`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=truststore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `verify-token-audience`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `provider` `verify-token-audience` attribute value.
* `verify-token-audience` attribute description: if set to 'true', then during `bearer-only` authentication, the subsystem verifies if the token contains the client name defined as an audience. it is recommended to set the value to 'true' for improved security.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/provider=<provider name>:read-attribute(name=verify-token-audience)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` use '*' for `<secure-server name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `adapter-state-cookie-path`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `adapter-state-cookie-path` attribute value.
* `adapter-state-cookie-path` attribute description: if set, this defines the path used in cookies set by the subsystem. this is useful when deploying an application in the root context path.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=adapter-state-cookie-path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `allow-any-hostname`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `allow-any-hostname` attribute value.
* `allow-any-hostname` attribute description: if set to 'true', `hostname` verification is skipped when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this can be useful in testing environments. this should never be set to 'true' in production environments as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=allow-any-hostname)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `always-refresh-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `always-refresh-token` attribute value.
* `always-refresh-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem refreshes the token every time your application receives a web request, and a new request is sent to the `openid` provider to obtain a new access token. this can result in a higher load on the `openid` provider and may impact the performance of the application.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=always-refresh-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `auth-server-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `auth-server-url` attribute value.
* `auth-server-url` attribute description: the base `url` of the `keycloak` authorization server. this is `keycloak-specific`. it is recommended to use '`provider-url`' instead.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=auth-server-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `autodetect-bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute value.
* `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute description: whether to `auto-detect` soap or rest clients based on headers like '`x-requested-with`', '`soapaction`' or 'accept'. if set to 'true', the subsystem sends an `http` `401` status code to unauthenticated soap or rest clients instead of redirecting them to the `openid` provider login page. set the value to 'true' if your application serves both applications and web services.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=autodetect-bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `bearer-only` attribute value.
* `bearer-only` attribute description: enable `bearer-token` only authentication. set this to 'true' if your application serves only web services and does not authenticate users.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-id`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-id` attribute value.
* `client-id` attribute description: the unique identifier for a client application registered in the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=client-id)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-keystore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-keystore` attribute value.
* `client-keystore` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` to use when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore`. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `confidential-port`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `confidential-port` attribute value.
* `confidential-port` attribute description: the confidential port used by the `openid` provider when communicating securely over `ssl/tls`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=confidential-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-pool-size` attribute value.
* `connection-pool-size` attribute description: the connection pool size to use when communicating with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for establishing a connection with the remote host in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-ttl-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `connection-ttl-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-ttl-millis` attribute description: the amount of time in milliseconds for the connection to be kept alive. a value less than or equal to zero is interpreted as an infinite value.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-ttl-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-allowed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-allowed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-allowed-methods`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-allowed-methods` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-methods` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-methods`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-methods)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-exposed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-exposed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-exposed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-expose-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=cors-exposed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-max-age`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `cors-max-age` attribute value.
* `cors-max-age` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-max-age`' header. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=cors-max-age)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` attribute value.
* `credential` attribute description: the credential used to communicate with the `openid` connect provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=credential)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `disable-trust-manager`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `disable-trust-manager` attribute value.
* `disable-trust-manager` attribute description: whether or not to make use of a trust manager when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional. this should be set to 'true' only during development and never in production as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=disable-trust-manager)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `enable-basic-auth`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `enable-basic-auth` attribute value.
* `enable-basic-auth` attribute description: enable basic authentication. this is not supported in the current release.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=enable-basic-auth)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `enable-cors`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `enable-cors` attribute value.
* `enable-cors` attribute description: enable the `keycloak` `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) support. this is optional. this is `keycloak-specific`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=enable-cors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `expose-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `expose-token` attribute value.
* `expose-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', an authenticated browser client can obtain the signed access token (through a `javascript` `http` invocation) via the `url` '`root/k_query_bearer_token`'. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=expose-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute value.
* `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute description: disable query parameter parsing for the '`access_token`'. users will not be able to authenticate if they only pass in an '`access_token`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=ignore-oauth-query-parameter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `min-time-between-jwks-requests`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `min-time-between-jwks-requests` attribute value.
* `min-time-between-jwks-requests` attribute description: if the subsystem recognizes a token signed by an unknown public key, it will try to download a new public key from the server. the subsystem `won't` try to download a public key if it already tried last in less than '`min-time-between-jwks-requests`' seconds.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=min-time-between-jwks-requests)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `principal-attribute`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `principal-attribute` attribute value.
* `principal-attribute` attribute description: indicates which value from the id token to use as the principal for the identity. the principal defaults to the value of the 'sub' if the token attribute is null.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=principal-attribute)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `provider`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `provider` attribute value.
* `provider` attribute description: the `openid` connect provider to use for authentication.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=provider)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `provider-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `provider-url` attribute value.
* `provider-url` attribute description: the `openid` provider `url`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=provider-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `proxy-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `proxy-url` attribute value.
* `proxy-url` attribute description: the `url` for the `http` proxy if one is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `public-client`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `public-client` attribute value.
* `public-client` attribute description: if set to 'true', no client credentials are sent when communicating with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=public-client)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `public-key-cache-ttl`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `public-key-cache-ttl` attribute value.
* `public-key-cache-ttl` attribute description: the maximum interval between two requests to retrieve new public keys in seconds. new public keys are downloaded when the subsystem recognizes a token signed by an unknown public key. even if the `token's` key is already known, new public keys are downloaded periodically as per the interval set here at least once.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=public-key-cache-ttl)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `realm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `realm` attribute value.
* `realm` attribute description: the `keycloak` realm to use for authentication.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=realm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `realm-public-key`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `realm-public-key` attribute value.
* `realm-public-key` attribute description: the public key of the `openid` provider in `pem` format. this is optional. it is not recommended to set it. if the public key is not set, the subsystem downloads the public key from the `openid` provider when needed. if the public key is set, the subsystem never downloads new keys from the `openid` provider, breaking the subsystem when the `openid` provider rotates its keys.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=realm-public-key)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule` attribute value.
* `redirect-rewrite-rule` attribute description: the rewrite rule for the redirect uri. the rewrite rule is an object notation, where the key is a regular expression with which the redirect uri is matched and the value is the replacement string.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=redirect-rewrite-rule)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `register-node-at-startup`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `register-node-at-startup` attribute value.
* `register-node-at-startup` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem sends a registration request to the `openid` provider. this attribute is useful only when your application is clustered.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-at-startup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `register-node-period`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `register-node-period` attribute value.
* `register-node-period` attribute description: if '`register-node-at-startup`' is set to 'true', this specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which the node should be `re-registered`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-period)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `resource`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `resource` attribute value.
* `resource` attribute description: the unique, legacy identifier for a client application registered in the `openid` provider. it is recommended to use the '`client-id`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=resource)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `socket-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `socket-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `socket-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for the socket waiting for data after establishing the connection in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=socket-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `ssl-required`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `ssl-required` attribute value.
* `ssl-required` attribute description: whether the communication with the `openid` provider should be over `https`. valid values are: 'all' - to always require `https`, 'external' - to only require `https` for external requests, 'none' - if `https` is not required. this should be set to 'all' in production environments.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-required)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-minimum-time-to-live`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-minimum-time-to-live` attribute value.
* `token-minimum-time-to-live` attribute description: the subsystem will refresh the token if it will expire within the duration specified in '`token-minimum-time-to-live`' seconds. this value should never exceed the access token lifespan. if the value is set to `0` seconds, the subsystem will refresh the token only if the token has expired.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=token-minimum-time-to-live)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-signature-algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-signature-algorithm` attribute value.
* `token-signature-algorithm` attribute description: the token signature algorithm used by the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=token-signature-algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-store`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `token-store` attribute value.
* `token-store` attribute description: defines whether to store account information in an `http` session or in a cookie.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=token-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `truststore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `truststore` attribute value.
* `truststore` attribute description: the path to the `truststore` to use when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. prefix the path with '`classpath`:' to obtain the `truststore` from the `deployment's` `classpath`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=truststore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `truststore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `truststore-password` attribute value.
* `truststore-password` attribute description: the password for the `truststore`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=truststore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login` attribute value.
* `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login` attribute description: the session id is changed by default on a successful login. set this to 'true' if you want to turn this off.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=turn-off-change-session-id-on-login)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `use-resource-role-mappings`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `use-resource-role-mappings` attribute value.
* `use-resource-role-mappings` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem will look inside the token for `application-level` role mappings for a user. if set to 'false', the subsystem will look at the `realm-level` for `user-role` mappings. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=use-resource-role-mappings)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `verify-token-audience`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `verify-token-audience` attribute value.
* `verify-token-audience` attribute description: if set to 'true', then during `bearer-only` authentication, the subsystem verifies if the token contains the client name defined as an audience. it is recommended to set the value to 'true' for improved security.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>:read-attribute(name=verify-token-audience)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/redirect-rewrite-rule=<redirect-rewrite-rule name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule` use '*' for `<redirect-rewrite-rule name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule` `replacement`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `redirect-rewrite-rule` `replacement` attribute value.
* `replacement` attribute description: the replacement string in the rewrite rule for the redirect uri.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/redirect-rewrite-rule=<redirect-rewrite-rule name>:read-attribute(name=replacement)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` use '*' for `<credential name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `algorithm` attribute value.
* `algorithm` attribute description: the credential signature algorithm used by the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-key-alias`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-key-alias` attribute value.
* `client-key-alias` attribute description: the client key alias when the credential provider is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-alias)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key when the credential provider is used. this is required if '`client-keystore-file`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-file`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-file` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-file` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` when the credential provider is used. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-file)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore` when the credential provider is used. this is required if '`client-keystore-file`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-type`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `client-keystore-type` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-type` attribute description: the client `keystore` type when the credential provider is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `secret`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `secret` attribute value.
* `secret` attribute description: the client secret that was registered with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=secret)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `token-timeout`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-server` `credential` `token-timeout` attribute value.
* `token-timeout` attribute description: the amount of time after which the token expires and can no longer be used to authenticate requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-server=<secure-server name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=token-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` use '*' for `<secure-deployment name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `adapter-state-cookie-path`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `adapter-state-cookie-path` attribute value.
* `adapter-state-cookie-path` attribute description: if set, this defines the path used in cookies set by the subsystem. this is useful when deploying an application in the root context path.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=adapter-state-cookie-path)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `allow-any-hostname`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `allow-any-hostname` attribute value.
* `allow-any-hostname` attribute description: if set to 'true', `hostname` verification is skipped when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this can be useful in testing environments. this should never be set to 'true' in production environments as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=allow-any-hostname)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `always-refresh-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `always-refresh-token` attribute value.
* `always-refresh-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem refreshes the token every time your application receives a web request, and a new request is sent to the `openid` provider to obtain a new access token. this can result in a higher load on the `openid` provider and may impact the performance of the application.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=always-refresh-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `auth-server-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `auth-server-url` attribute value.
* `auth-server-url` attribute description: the base `url` of the `keycloak` authorization server. this is `keycloak-specific`. it is recommended to use '`provider-url`' instead.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=auth-server-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `autodetect-bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute value.
* `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute description: whether to `auto-detect` soap or rest clients based on headers like '`x-requested-with`', '`soapaction`' or 'accept'. if set to 'true', the subsystem sends an `http` `401` status code to unauthenticated soap or rest clients instead of redirecting them to the `openid` provider login page. set the value to 'true' if your application serves both applications and web services.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=autodetect-bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `bearer-only` attribute value.
* `bearer-only` attribute description: enable `bearer-token` only authentication. set this to 'true' if your application serves only web services and does not authenticate users.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-id`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-id` attribute value.
* `client-id` attribute description: the unique identifier for a client application registered in the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=client-id)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-keystore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-keystore` attribute value.
* `client-keystore` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` to use when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore`. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `confidential-port`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `confidential-port` attribute value.
* `confidential-port` attribute description: the confidential port used by the `openid` provider when communicating securely over `ssl/tls`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=confidential-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-pool-size` attribute value.
* `connection-pool-size` attribute description: the connection pool size to use when communicating with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=connection-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for establishing a connection with the remote host in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=connection-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-ttl-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `connection-ttl-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-ttl-millis` attribute description: the amount of time in milliseconds for the connection to be kept alive. a value less than or equal to zero is interpreted as an infinite value.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=connection-ttl-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-allowed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-allowed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-allowed-methods`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-allowed-methods` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-methods` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-methods`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-methods)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-exposed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-exposed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-exposed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-expose-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=cors-exposed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-max-age`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `cors-max-age` attribute value.
* `cors-max-age` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-max-age`' header. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=cors-max-age)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` attribute value.
* `credential` attribute description: the credential used to communicate with the `openid` connect provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=credential)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `disable-trust-manager`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `disable-trust-manager` attribute value.
* `disable-trust-manager` attribute description: whether or not to make use of a trust manager when communicating with the `openid` provider over `https`. this is optional. this should be set to 'true' only during development and never in production as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=disable-trust-manager)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `enable-basic-auth`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `enable-basic-auth` attribute value.
* `enable-basic-auth` attribute description: enable basic authentication. this is not supported in the current release.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=enable-basic-auth)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `enable-cors`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `enable-cors` attribute value.
* `enable-cors` attribute description: enable the `keycloak` `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) support. this is optional. this is `keycloak-specific`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=enable-cors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `expose-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `expose-token` attribute value.
* `expose-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', an authenticated browser client can obtain the signed access token (through a `javascript` `http` invocation) via the `url` '`root/k_query_bearer_token`'. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=expose-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute value.
* `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute description: disable query parameter parsing for the '`access_token`'. users will not be able to authenticate if they only pass in an '`access_token`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=ignore-oauth-query-parameter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `min-time-between-jwks-requests`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `min-time-between-jwks-requests` attribute value.
* `min-time-between-jwks-requests` attribute description: if the subsystem recognizes a token signed by an unknown public key, it will try to download a new public key from the server. the subsystem `won't` try to download a public key if it already tried last in less than '`min-time-between-jwks-requests`' seconds.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=min-time-between-jwks-requests)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `principal-attribute`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `principal-attribute` attribute value.
* `principal-attribute` attribute description: indicates which value from the id token to use as the principal for the identity. the principal defaults to the value of the 'sub' if the token attribute is null.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=principal-attribute)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `provider`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `provider` attribute value.
* `provider` attribute description: the `openid` connect provider to use for authentication.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=provider)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `provider-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `provider-url` attribute value.
* `provider-url` attribute description: the `openid` provider `url`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=provider-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `proxy-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `proxy-url` attribute value.
* `proxy-url` attribute description: the `url` for the `http` proxy if one is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `public-client`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `public-client` attribute value.
* `public-client` attribute description: if set to 'true', no client credentials are sent when communicating with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=public-client)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `public-key-cache-ttl`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `public-key-cache-ttl` attribute value.
* `public-key-cache-ttl` attribute description: the maximum interval between two requests to retrieve new public keys in seconds. new public keys are downloaded when the subsystem recognizes a token signed by an unknown public key. even if the `token's` key is already known, new public keys are downloaded periodically as per the interval set here at least once.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=public-key-cache-ttl)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `realm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `realm` attribute value.
* `realm` attribute description: the `keycloak` realm to use for authentication.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=realm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `realm-public-key`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `realm-public-key` attribute value.
* `realm-public-key` attribute description: the public key of the `openid` provider in `pem` format. this is optional. it is not recommended to set it. if the public key is not set, the subsystem downloads the public key from the `openid` provider when needed. if the public key is set, the subsystem never downloads new keys from the `openid` provider, breaking the subsystem when the `openid` provider rotates its keys.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=realm-public-key)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule` attribute value.
* `redirect-rewrite-rule` attribute description: the rewrite rule for the redirect uri. the rewrite rule is an object notation, where the key is a regular expression with which the redirect uri is matched and the value is the replacement string.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=redirect-rewrite-rule)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `register-node-at-startup`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `register-node-at-startup` attribute value.
* `register-node-at-startup` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem sends a registration request to the `openid` provider. this attribute is useful only when your application is clustered.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-at-startup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `register-node-period`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `register-node-period` attribute value.
* `register-node-period` attribute description: if '`register-node-at-startup`' is set to 'true', this specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which the node should be `re-registered`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-period)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `resource`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `resource` attribute value.
* `resource` attribute description: the unique, legacy identifier for a client application registered in the `openid` provider. it is recommended to use the '`client-id`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=resource)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `socket-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `socket-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `socket-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for the socket waiting for data after establishing the connection in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=socket-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `ssl-required`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `ssl-required` attribute value.
* `ssl-required` attribute description: whether the communication with the `openid` provider should be over `https`. valid values are: 'all' - to always require `https`, 'external' - to only require `https` for external requests, 'none' - if `https` is not required. this should be set to 'all' in production environments.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-required)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-minimum-time-to-live`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-minimum-time-to-live` attribute value.
* `token-minimum-time-to-live` attribute description: the subsystem will refresh the token if it will expire within the duration specified in '`token-minimum-time-to-live`' seconds. this value should never exceed the access token lifespan. if the value is set to `0` seconds, the subsystem will refresh the token only if the token has expired.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=token-minimum-time-to-live)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-signature-algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-signature-algorithm` attribute value.
* `token-signature-algorithm` attribute description: the token signature algorithm used by the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=token-signature-algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-store`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `token-store` attribute value.
* `token-store` attribute description: defines whether to store account information in an `http` session or in a cookie.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=token-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `truststore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `truststore` attribute value.
* `truststore` attribute description: the path to the `truststore` to use when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. prefix the path with '`classpath`:' to obtain the `truststore` from the `deployment's` `classpath`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=truststore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `truststore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `truststore-password` attribute value.
* `truststore-password` attribute description: the password for the `truststore`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=truststore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login` attribute value.
* `turn-off-change-session-id-on-login` attribute description: the session id is changed by default on a successful login. set this to 'true' if you want to turn this off.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=turn-off-change-session-id-on-login)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `use-resource-role-mappings`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `use-resource-role-mappings` attribute value.
* `use-resource-role-mappings` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem will look inside the token for `application-level` role mappings for a user. if set to 'false', the subsystem will look at the `realm-level` for `user-role` mappings. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=use-resource-role-mappings)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `verify-token-audience`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `verify-token-audience` attribute value.
* `verify-token-audience` attribute description: if set to 'true', then during `bearer-only` authentication, the subsystem verifies if the token contains the client name defined as an audience. it is recommended to set the value to 'true' for improved security.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>:read-attribute(name=verify-token-audience)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/redirect-rewrite-rule=<redirect-rewrite-rule name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule` use '*' for `<redirect-rewrite-rule name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule` `replacement`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `redirect-rewrite-rule` `replacement` attribute value.
* `replacement` attribute description: the replacement string in the rewrite rule for the redirect uri.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/redirect-rewrite-rule=<redirect-rewrite-rule name>:read-attribute(name=replacement)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` use '*' for `<credential name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `algorithm` attribute value.
* `algorithm` attribute description: the credential signature algorithm used by the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-key-alias`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-key-alias` attribute value.
* `client-key-alias` attribute description: the client key alias when the credential provider is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-alias)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key when the credential provider is used. this is required if '`client-keystore-file`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-file`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-file` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-file` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` when the credential provider is used. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-file)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore` when the credential provider is used. this is required if '`client-keystore-file`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-type`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `client-keystore-type` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-type` attribute description: the client `keystore` type when the credential provider is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `secret`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `secret` attribute value.
* `secret` attribute description: the client secret that was registered with the `openid` provider.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=secret)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `token-timeout`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `secure-deployment` `credential` `token-timeout` attribute value.
* `token-timeout` attribute description: the amount of time after which the token expires and can no longer be used to authenticate requests.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/secure-deployment=<secure-deployment name>/credential=<credential name>:read-attribute(name=token-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `elytron-oidc-client` `realm`
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` use '*' for `<realm name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `allow-any-hostname`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `allow-any-hostname` attribute value.
* `allow-any-hostname` attribute description: if set to 'true', `hostname` verification will be skipped when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. this can be useful in testing environments. this should never be set to 'true' in production environments as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=allow-any-hostname)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `always-refresh-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `always-refresh-token` attribute value.
* `always-refresh-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem refreshes the token every time your application receives a web request, and a new request is sent to `keycloak` to obtain a new access token. this can result in a higher load on the `keycloak` and may impact the performance of the application.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=always-refresh-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `auth-server-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `auth-server-url` attribute value.
* `auth-server-url` attribute description: the base `url` of the `keycloak` authorization server. it is recommended to use the '`provider-url`' instead.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=auth-server-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `autodetect-bearer-only`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute value.
* `autodetect-bearer-only` attribute description: whether to `auto-detect` soap or rest clients based on headers like '`x-requested-with`', '`soapaction`' or 'accept'. if set to 'true', the subsystem sends an `http` `401` status code to unauthenticated soap or rest clients instead of redirecting them to the `keycloak` login page. set the value to 'true' if your application serves both applications and web services.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=autodetect-bearer-only)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-key-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-key-password` attribute value.
* `client-key-password` attribute description: the password for the client key. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=client-key-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-keystore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-keystore` attribute value.
* `client-keystore` attribute description: the path to the client `keystore` to use when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-keystore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `client-keystore-password` attribute value.
* `client-keystore-password` attribute description: the password for the client `keystore`. this is required if '`client-keystore`' has been specified.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=client-keystore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `confidential-port`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `confidential-port` attribute value.
* `confidential-port` attribute description: the confidential port used by `keycloak` when communicating securely over `ssl/tls`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=confidential-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-pool-size` attribute value.
* `connection-pool-size` attribute description: the connection pool size to use when communicating with `keycloak`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=connection-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for establishing a connection with the remote host in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=connection-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-ttl-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `connection-ttl-millis` attribute value.
* `connection-ttl-millis` attribute description: the amount of time in milliseconds for the connection to be kept alive. a value less than or equal to zero is interpreted as an infinite value.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=connection-ttl-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-allowed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-allowed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-allowed-methods`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-allowed-methods` attribute value.
* `cors-allowed-methods` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-allow-methods`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=cors-allowed-methods)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-exposed-headers`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-exposed-headers` attribute value.
* `cors-exposed-headers` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-expose-headers`' header. this should be a `comma-separated` string. this is optional. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=cors-exposed-headers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-max-age`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `cors-max-age` attribute value.
* `cors-max-age` attribute description: if `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) is enabled, this sets the value of the '`access-control-max-age`' header. if not set, this header is not returned in `cors` responses.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=cors-max-age)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `disable-trust-manager`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `disable-trust-manager` attribute value.
* `disable-trust-manager` attribute description: whether or not to make use of a trust manager when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. this is optional. this should be set to 'true' only during development and never in production as it disables verification of `ssl` certificates.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=disable-trust-manager)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `enable-cors`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `enable-cors` attribute value.
* `enable-cors` attribute description: enable the `keycloak` `cross-origin` resource sharing (`cors`) support. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=enable-cors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `expose-token`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `expose-token` attribute value.
* `expose-token` attribute description: if set to 'true', an authenticated browser client can obtain the signed access token (through a `javascript` `http` invocation) via the `url` '`root/k_query_bearer_token`'. this is optional.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=expose-token)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute value.
* `ignore-oauth-query-parameter` attribute description: disable query parameter parsing for the '`access_token`'. users will not be able to authenticate if they only pass in an '`access_token`'.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=ignore-oauth-query-parameter)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `principal-attribute`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `principal-attribute` attribute value.
* `principal-attribute` attribute description: indicates which value from the id token to use as the principal for the identity. the principal defaults to the value of the 'sub' if the token attribute is null.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=principal-attribute)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `provider-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `provider-url` attribute value.
* `provider-url` attribute description: the `openid` provider `url`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=provider-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `proxy-url`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `proxy-url` attribute value.
* `proxy-url` attribute description: the `url` for the `http` proxy if one is used.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=proxy-url)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `realm-public-key`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `realm-public-key` attribute value.
* `realm-public-key` attribute description: the public key of the `keycloak` realm in `pem` format. this is optional. it is not recommended to set it. if the public key is not set, the subsystem downloads the public key from `keycloak` when needed. if the public key is set, the subsystem never downloads new keys from `keycloak`, breaking the subsystem when `keycloak` rotates its keys.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=realm-public-key)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `register-node-at-startup`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `register-node-at-startup` attribute value.
* `register-node-at-startup` attribute description: if set to 'true', the subsystem sends a registration request to `keycloak`. this attribute is useful only when your application is clustered.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-at-startup)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `register-node-period`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `register-node-period` attribute value.
* `register-node-period` attribute description: if '`register-node-at-startup`' is set to 'true', this specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which the node should be `re-registered`.
