* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=register-node-period)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `socket-timeout-millis`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `socket-timeout-millis` attribute value.
* `socket-timeout-millis` attribute description: the timeout for the socket waiting for data after establishing the connection in milliseconds. a timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout, and a negative value is interpreted as undefined.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=socket-timeout-millis)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `ssl-required`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `ssl-required` attribute value.
* `ssl-required` attribute description: whether the communication with `keycloak` should be over `https`. valid values are: 'all' - to always require `https`, 'external' - to only require `https` for external requests, 'none' - if `https` is not required. this should be set to 'all' in production environments.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=ssl-required)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `token-signature-algorithm`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `token-signature-algorithm` attribute value.
* `token-signature-algorithm` attribute description: the token signature algorithm used by `keycloak`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=token-signature-algorithm)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `token-store`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `token-store` attribute value.
* `token-store` attribute description: defines whether to store account information in an `http` session or in a cookie.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=token-store)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `truststore`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `truststore` attribute value.
* `truststore` attribute description: the path to the `truststore` to use when communicating with `keycloak` over `https`. prefix the path with '`classpath`:' to obtain the `truststore` from the `deployment's` `classpath`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=truststore)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `truststore-password`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `truststore-password` attribute value.
* `truststore-password` attribute description: the password for the `truststore`.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=truststore-password)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `verify-token-audience`
* Retrieve the `elytron-oidc-client` `realm` `verify-token-audience` attribute value.
* `verify-token-audience` attribute description: if set to 'true', then during `bearer-only` authentication, the subsystem verifies if the token contains the client name defined as an audience. it is recommended to set to 'true' for improved security.
* operation: `/subsystem=elytron-oidc-client/realm=<realm name>:read-attribute(name=verify-token-audience)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `default-worker`
* Retrieve the `io` `default-worker` attribute value.
* `default-worker` attribute description: specifies the default `i/o` worker
* operation: `/subsystem=io:read-attribute(name=default-worker)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `io` `worker`
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `io` `worker` use '*' for `<worker name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `busy-task-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `busy-task-thread-count` attribute value.
* `busy-task-thread-count` attribute description: an estimate of busy threads in the task worker thread pool
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=busy-task-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `core-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `core-pool-size` attribute value.
* `core-pool-size` attribute description: minimum number of threads to keep in the underlying thread pool even if they are idle. threads over this limit will be terminated over time specified by `task-keepalive` attribute.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=core-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `io-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `io-thread-count` attribute value.
* `io-thread-count` attribute description: `i/o` thread count
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=io-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `io-threads`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `io-threads` attribute value.
* `io-threads` attribute description: specify the number of `i/o` threads to create for the worker.  if not specified, a default will be chosen, which is calculated by `cpucount` * `2`
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=io-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `max-pool-size`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `max-pool-size` attribute value.
* `max-pool-size` attribute description: the maximum number of threads allowed in the worker task thread pool. depending on the pool implementation, when this limit is reached tasks which cannot be queued may be rejected. this can be configured using the '`task-max-threads`' attribute; see the description of that attribute for details on how this value is determined.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=max-pool-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `queue-size`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `queue-size` attribute value.
* `queue-size` attribute description: an estimate of the number of tasks in the worker queue.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=queue-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `shutdown-requested`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `shutdown-requested` attribute value.
* `shutdown-requested` attribute description: true is shutdown of the pool was requested
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=shutdown-requested)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `stack-size`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `stack-size` attribute value.
* `stack-size` attribute description: the stack size (in bytes) to attempt to use for worker threads.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=stack-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `task-core-threads`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `task-core-threads` attribute value.
* `task-core-threads` attribute description: specify the starting number of threads for the worker task thread pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=task-core-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `task-keepalive`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `task-keepalive` attribute value.
* `task-keepalive` attribute description: specify the number of milliseconds to keep `non-core` task threads alive.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=task-keepalive)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `task-max-threads`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `task-max-threads` attribute value.
* `task-max-threads` attribute description: specify the maximum number of threads for the worker task thread `pool.if` not set, a default value used which is calculated by the formula `cpucount` * `16,as` long as the `maxfiledescriptorcount` `jmx` property allows that number; otherwise the calculation takes that max into account and adjusts accordingly.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>:read-attribute(name=task-max-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address`
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/outbound-bind-address=<outbound-bind-address name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` use '*' for `<outbound-bind-address name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `bind-address`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `bind-address` attribute value.
* `bind-address` attribute description: the address to bind to when the destination address matches
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/outbound-bind-address=<outbound-bind-address name>:read-attribute(name=bind-address)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `bind-port`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `bind-port` attribute value.
* `bind-port` attribute description: the port number to bind to when the destination address matches
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/outbound-bind-address=<outbound-bind-address name>:read-attribute(name=bind-port)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `match`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `outbound-bind-address` `match` attribute value.
* `match` attribute description: the destination address range to match
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/outbound-bind-address=<outbound-bind-address name>:read-attribute(name=match)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `io` `worker` `server`
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/server=<server name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `io` `worker` `server` use '*' for `<server name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-count`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-count` attribute value.
* `connection-count` attribute description: estimate of the current connection count
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/server=<server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-limit-high-water-mark`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-limit-high-water-mark` attribute value.
* `connection-limit-high-water-mark` attribute description: if the connection count hits this number, no new connections will be accepted until the count drops below the `low-water` mark.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/server=<server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-limit-high-water-mark)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-limit-low-water-mark`
* Retrieve the `io` `worker` `server` `connection-limit-low-water-mark` attribute value.
* `connection-limit-low-water-mark` attribute description: if the connection count has previously hit the high water mark, once it drops back down below this count, connections will be accepted again.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/worker=<worker name>/server=<server name>:read-attribute(name=connection-limit-low-water-mark)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `io` `buffer-pool`
* operation: `/subsystem=io/buffer-pool=<buffer-pool name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `io` `buffer-pool` use '*' for `<buffer-pool name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `buffer-pool` `buffer-size`
* Retrieve the `io` `buffer-pool` `buffer-size` attribute value.
* `buffer-size` attribute description: the size of each buffer slice in bytes, if not set optimal value is calculated based on available ram resources in your system.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/buffer-pool=<buffer-pool name>:read-attribute(name=buffer-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `buffer-pool` `buffers-per-slice`
* Retrieve the `io` `buffer-pool` `buffers-per-slice` attribute value.
* `buffers-per-slice` attribute description: how many buffers per slice, if not set optimal value is calculated based on available ram resources in your system.
* operation: `/subsystem=io/buffer-pool=<buffer-pool name>:read-attribute(name=buffers-per-slice)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `io` `buffer-pool` `direct-buffers`
* Retrieve the `io` `buffer-pool` `direct-buffers` attribute value.
* `direct-buffers` attribute description: does the buffer pool use direct buffers, some platforms `don't` support direct buffers
* operation: `/subsystem=io/buffer-pool=<buffer-pool name>:read-attribute(name=direct-buffers)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `allow-ejb-name-regex`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `allow-ejb-name-regex` attribute value.
* `allow-ejb-name-regex` attribute description: if this is true then regular expressions can be used in interceptor bindings to allow interceptors to be mapped to all beans that match the regular expression
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=allow-ejb-name-regex)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `client-interceptors`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `client-interceptors` attribute value.
* `client-interceptors` attribute description: client interceptor definitions.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=client-interceptors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-clustered-sfsb-cache`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-clustered-sfsb-cache` attribute value.
* `default-clustered-sfsb-cache` attribute description: name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all clustered stateful jakarta enterprise beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-clustered-sfsb-cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-distinct-name`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-distinct-name` attribute value.
* `default-distinct-name` attribute description: the default distinct name that is applied to every jakarta enterprise beans deployed on this server
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-distinct-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-entity-bean-instance-pool`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-entity-bean-instance-pool` attribute value.
* `default-entity-bean-instance-pool` attribute description: name of the default entity bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all entity beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-entity-bean-instance-pool)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking` attribute value.
* `default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking` attribute description: if set to true entity beans will use optimistic locking by default
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-mdb-instance-pool`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-mdb-instance-pool` attribute value.
* `default-mdb-instance-pool` attribute description: name of the default `mdb` instance pool, which will be applicable to all `mdbs`, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-mdb-instance-pool)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-missing-method-permissions-deny-access`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-missing-method-permissions-deny-access` attribute value.
* `default-missing-method-permissions-deny-access` attribute description: if this is set to true then methods on jakarta enterprise beans with a security domain specified or with other methods with security `metadata` will have an implicit @`denyall` unless other security `metadata` is present
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-missing-method-permissions-deny-access)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-resource-adapter-name`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-resource-adapter-name` attribute value.
* `default-resource-adapter-name` attribute description: name of the default resource adapter name that will be used by `mdbs`, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-resource-adapter-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-security-domain`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-security-domain` attribute value.
* `default-security-domain` attribute description: the default security domain that will be used for jakarta enterprise beans if the bean `doesn't` explicitly specify one
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-sfsb-cache`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-sfsb-cache` attribute value.
* `default-sfsb-cache` attribute description: name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all stateful jakarta enterprise beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-sfsb-cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-sfsb-passivation-disabled-cache`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-sfsb-passivation-disabled-cache` attribute value.
* `default-sfsb-passivation-disabled-cache` attribute description: name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all stateful jakarta enterprise beans that have passivation disabled. each deployment or jakarta enterprise beans can optionally override this cache name.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-sfsb-passivation-disabled-cache)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-singleton-bean-access-timeout`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-singleton-bean-access-timeout` attribute value.
* `default-singleton-bean-access-timeout` attribute description: the default access timeout for singleton beans
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-singleton-bean-access-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-slsb-instance-pool`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-slsb-instance-pool` attribute value.
* `default-slsb-instance-pool` attribute description: name of the default stateless bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all stateless jakarta enterprise beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-slsb-instance-pool)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-stateful-bean-access-timeout`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-stateful-bean-access-timeout` attribute value.
* `default-stateful-bean-access-timeout` attribute description: the default access timeout for stateful beans
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-stateful-bean-access-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `default-stateful-bean-session-timeout`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `default-stateful-bean-session-timeout` attribute value.
* `default-stateful-bean-session-timeout` attribute description: the default session timeout for stateful beans. modification to this attribute takes effect immediately for subsequent deployments; for jakarta enterprise beans already deployed, redeploying is needed to use the new value.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=default-stateful-bean-session-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `disable-default-ejb-permissions`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `disable-default-ejb-permissions` attribute value.
* `disable-default-ejb-permissions` attribute description: this deprecated attribute has no effect and will be removed in a future release; it may never be set to a "false" value
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=disable-default-ejb-permissions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `enable-graceful-txn-shutdown`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `enable-graceful-txn-shutdown` attribute value.
* `enable-graceful-txn-shutdown` attribute description: enabling `txn` graceful shutdown will make the server wait for active remote jakarta enterprise `beans-related` transactions to complete before suspending. for that reason, if the server is running on a cluster, the suspending cluster node may receive jakarta enterprise beans requests until all active remote transactions are complete. to avoid this behavior, omit this tag. this attribute has no effect on local jakarta enterprise `beans-related` transactions.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=enable-graceful-txn-shutdown)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `enable-statistics`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `enable-statistics` attribute value.
* `enable-statistics` attribute description: if set to true, enable the collection of invocation statistics. deprecated in favour of "`statistics-enabled`"
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=enable-statistics)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value` attribute value.
* `in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value` attribute description: if set to false, the parameters to invocations on the remote interface of a jakarta enterprise beans, will be passed by reference. else, the parameters will be passed by value.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `log-system-exceptions`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `log-system-exceptions` attribute value.
* `log-system-exceptions` attribute description: if this is true then all jakarta enterprise beans system (not application) exceptions will be logged. the jakarta enterprise beans spec mandates this behaviour, however, it is not recommended as it will often result in exceptions being logged twice (once by the jakarta enterprise beans and once by the calling code)
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=log-system-exceptions)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `server-interceptors`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `server-interceptors` attribute value.
* `server-interceptors` attribute description: server interceptor definitions.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=server-interceptors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `statistics-enabled`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `statistics-enabled` attribute value.
* `statistics-enabled` attribute description: if set to true, enable the collection of invocation statistics.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3:read-attribute(name=statistics-enabled)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `remoting-profile`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` use '*' for `<remoting-profile name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `exclude-local-receiver`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `exclude-local-receiver` attribute value.
* `exclude-local-receiver` attribute description: if set no local receiver is used in this profile
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>:read-attribute(name=exclude-local-receiver)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `local-receiver-pass-by-value`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `local-receiver-pass-by-value` attribute value.
* `local-receiver-pass-by-value` attribute description: if set local receiver will pass `ejb` beans by value
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>:read-attribute(name=local-receiver-pass-by-value)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `static-ejb-discovery`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `static-ejb-discovery` attribute value.
* `static-ejb-discovery` attribute description: describes static discovery `config` for jakarta enterprise `beans's`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>:read-attribute(name=static-ejb-discovery)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` use '*' for `<remoting-ejb-receiver name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `connect-timeout`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `connect-timeout` attribute value.
* `connect-timeout` attribute description: `remoting` `ejb` receiver connect timeout
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>:read-attribute(name=connect-timeout)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `outbound-connection-ref`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `outbound-connection-ref` attribute value.
* `outbound-connection-ref` attribute description: name of outbound connection that will be used by the `ejb` receiver
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>:read-attribute(name=outbound-connection-ref)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>/channel-creation-options=<channel-creation-options name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options` use '*' for `<channel-creation-options name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options` `type`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: the type of the channel creation option
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>/channel-creation-options=<channel-creation-options name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options` `value`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remoting-ejb-receiver` `channel-creation-options` `value` attribute value.
* `value` attribute description: the value for the jakarta enterprise beans remote channel creation option
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remoting-ejb-receiver=<remoting-ejb-receiver name>/channel-creation-options=<channel-creation-options name>:read-attribute(name=value)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remote-http-connection`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remote-http-connection=<remote-http-connection name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remote-http-connection` use '*' for `<remote-http-connection name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remote-http-connection` `uri`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `remoting-profile` `remote-http-connection` `uri` attribute value.
* `uri` attribute description: remote `http` connection uri
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/remoting-profile=<remoting-profile name>/remote-http-connection=<remote-http-connection name>:read-attribute(name=uri)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `mdb-delivery-group`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/mdb-delivery-group=<mdb-delivery-group name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `mdb-delivery-group` use '*' for `<mdb-delivery-group name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `mdb-delivery-group` `active`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `mdb-delivery-group` `active` attribute value.
* `active` attribute description: indicates if delivery for all `mdbs` belonging to this group is active
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/mdb-delivery-group=<mdb-delivery-group name>:read-attribute(name=active)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `application-security-domain`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/application-security-domain=<application-security-domain name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` use '*' for `<application-security-domain name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `enable-jacc`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `enable-jacc` attribute value.
* `enable-jacc` attribute description: enable authorization using jakarta authorization
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/application-security-domain=<application-security-domain name>:read-attribute(name=enable-jacc)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `legacy-compliant-principal-propagation`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `legacy-compliant-principal-propagation` attribute value.
* `legacy-compliant-principal-propagation` attribute description: option to switch between legacy compliant principal propagation or elytron principal propagation
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/application-security-domain=<application-security-domain name>:read-attribute(name=legacy-compliant-principal-propagation)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `referencing-deployments`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `referencing-deployments` attribute value.
* `referencing-deployments` attribute description: the deployments currently referencing this mapping
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/application-security-domain=<application-security-domain name>:read-attribute(name=referencing-deployments)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `security-domain`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `application-security-domain` `security-domain` attribute value.
* `security-domain` attribute description: the elytron security domain to be used by deployments that reference the mapped security domain
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/application-security-domain=<application-security-domain name>:read-attribute(name=security-domain)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `thread-pool`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `thread-pool` use '*' for `<thread-pool name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `active-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `active-count` attribute value.
* `active-count` attribute description: the approximate number of threads that are actively executing tasks.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=active-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `completed-task-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `completed-task-count` attribute value.
* `completed-task-count` attribute description: the approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=completed-task-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `core-threads`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `core-threads` attribute value.
* `core-threads` attribute description: the core thread pool size which is smaller than the maximum pool size. if undefined, the core thread pool size is the same as the maximum thread pool size.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=core-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `current-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `current-thread-count` attribute value.
* `current-thread-count` attribute description: the current number of threads in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=current-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `keepalive-time`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `keepalive-time` attribute value.
* `keepalive-time` attribute description: used to specify the amount of time that pool threads should be kept running when idle; if not specified, threads will run until the executor is shut down.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=keepalive-time)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `largest-thread-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `largest-thread-count` attribute value.
* `largest-thread-count` attribute description: the largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=largest-thread-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `max-threads`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `max-threads` attribute value.
* `max-threads` attribute description: the maximum thread pool size.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=max-threads)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `name`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `name` attribute value.
* `name` attribute description: the name of the thread pool.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=name)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `queue-size`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `queue-size` attribute value.
* `queue-size` attribute description: the queue size.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=queue-size)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `rejected-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `rejected-count` attribute value.
* `rejected-count` attribute description: the number of tasks that have been rejected.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=rejected-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `task-count`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `task-count` attribute value.
* `task-count` attribute description: the approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=task-count)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `thread-factory`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `thread-pool` `thread-factory` attribute value.
* `thread-factory` attribute description: specifies the name of a specific thread factory to use to create worker threads. if not defined an appropriate default thread factory will be used.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/thread-pool=<thread-pool name>:read-attribute(name=thread-factory)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `cluster`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `cluster` attribute value.
* `cluster` attribute description: the name of the clustered cache container which will be used to `store/access` the `client-mappings` of the jakarta enterprise beans `remoting` `connector's` `socket-binding` on each node, in the cluster
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote:read-attribute(name=cluster)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `connector-ref`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `connector-ref` attribute value.
* `connector-ref` attribute description: the name of the connector on which the enterprise beans `3` `remoting` channel is registered.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote:read-attribute(name=connector-ref)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `connectors`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `connectors` attribute value.
* `connectors` attribute description: a list of names of connectors on which the enterprise beans `3` invocations are received.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote:read-attribute(name=connectors)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `execute-in-worker`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `execute-in-worker` attribute value.
* `execute-in-worker` attribute description: if this is true the jakarta enterprise beans request will be executed in the io subsystems worker, otherwise it will dispatch to the jakarta enterprise beans thread pool
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote:read-attribute(name=execute-in-worker)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `thread-pool-name`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `thread-pool-name` attribute value.
* `thread-pool-name` attribute description: the name of the thread pool that handles remote invocations
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote:read-attribute(name=thread-pool-name)`

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `service` `remote` `channel-creation-options`
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote/channel-creation-options=<channel-creation-options name>:read-resource()`
* To get the list of all the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `channel-creation-options` use '*' for `<channel-creation-options name>`.

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `channel-creation-options` `type`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `remote` `channel-creation-options` `type` attribute value.
* `type` attribute description: the type of the channel creation option
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=remote/channel-creation-options=<channel-creation-options name>:read-attribute(name=type)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `iiop` `enable-by-default`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `iiop` `enable-by-default` attribute value.

* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `default-persistent-timer-management` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=timer-service:read-attribute(name=default-persistent-timer-management)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `default-transient-timer-management`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `default-transient-timer-management` attribute value.

* `thread-pool-name` attribute description: the name of the thread pool used to run timer service invocations

## syntax of the operation to get a `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `allow-execution`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `allow-execution` attribute value.
* `allow-execution` attribute description: if this node is allowed to execute timers. if this is false then the timers will be added to the database, and another node may execute them. note that depending on your refresh interval if you add timers with a very short delay they will not be executed until another node refreshes.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=timer-service/database-data-store=<database-data-store name>:read-attribute(name=allow-execution)`

* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `database` attribute value.
* `database` attribute description: the type of database that is in use. `sql` can be `customised` per database type. common values are: `postgresql`, `mysql`, `mariadb`, `db2`, `hsql`, `h2`, oracle, `mssql` and `sybase`.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=timer-service/database-data-store=<database-data-store name>:read-attribute(name=database)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `datasource-jndi-name`

* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `partition` attribute value.

* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=timer-service/database-data-store=<database-data-store name>:read-attribute(name=partition)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `refresh-interval`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `service` `timer-service` `database-data-store` `refresh-interval` attribute value.
* `refresh-interval` attribute description: interval between refreshing the current timer set against the underlying database. a low value means timers get picked up more quickly, but increase load on the database.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/service=timer-service/database-data-store=<database-data-store name>:read-attribute(name=refresh-interval)`

## syntax of the operation to get the `ejb3` `strict-max-bean-instance-pool` `derive-size`
* Retrieve the `ejb3` `strict-max-bean-instance-pool` `derive-size` attribute value.
* `derive-size` attribute description: specifies if and what the max pool size should be derived from. an undefined value (or the deprecated value 'none' which is converted to undefined) indicates that the explicit value of `max-pool-size` should be used. a value of '`from-worker-pools`' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the size of the total threads for all worker pools configured on the system. a value of '`from-cpu-count`' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the total number of processors available on the system. note that the computation `isn't` a `1:1` mapping, the values may or may not be augmented by other factors.
* operation: `/subsystem=ejb3/strict-max-bean-instance-pool=<strict-max-bean-instance-pool name>:read-attribute(name=derive-size)`
